The breakfast choices were terrific...especially when traveling with 2 picky children. I would stay here again...and highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Trip Advisor reviews are correct”
Reviews.Author: wachoman
Reviews.Content: Excellent and friendly service, clean, and safe. Those are the things that I hope for in a hotel and you never know when you book online. We came all the way from Ohio and when we checked in, we were so happy. Walked around in the hotel room with no shoes and it was clean! Rates are very, very reasonable and no lie, you can get to nearly every attraction in San Diego in 10 minutes or less. If you are not looking to stay Downtown or at Seaworld, then this is the place. Don't waste your time looking at all the other hotels on trip advisor like I did...you won't be disappointed. Parking is free and the Wi-Fi is free and it worked in my room. Continental breakfast was limited but it worked for us and we ate there every morning.

Reviews.Title: “The friendliest hotel I've ever stayed at!”
Reviews.Author: Travellingcutie
Reviews.Content: My husband and kids (ages 4 and 2) booked a stay at Old Town Inn, based on the great reviews here on TripAdvisor. And we're glad we did! As other reviews have mentioned, the location is a little strange, not near other hotels or residential areas either. But it is within minutes of the airport, and is right across the street from the transit center, so there's easy access to buses, trolleys and trains. We did not have a rental car, so were reliant on public transport, but if you have a car, there is free parking. When we checked in (at 10 AM!) the front desk people gave us lots of information on the area, including a guide to getting around by public transport, with tips on how to get to local attractions, grocery store, beaches and more. Very helpful! The closest grocery store is just a couple of bus stops away. There are also tons of other stores (Target and such) as well as a lot of fast food in that area. Super close if you have a car and very accessible by bus as well. We spent our first two nights in the one bedroom suite. There was so much space in this suite- we loved it! Everything was clean and well-stocked. Wi-fi didn't work in this room, but the front desk gave us a cord to use the high speed with our laptop. We also enjoyed the ability to check out DVDs- a great end to our busy days in San Diego. Breakfast was plentiful and delicious- heavy on the carbs, but still good. Coffee, tea, and water are available all day in the lobby as well. If you need to do laundry, there are a couple of coin-operated machines near the lobby. We especially appreciated this, when traveling with little kids. The hotel was quiet and we slept well all of the nights that we were there. For our last night, we switched to a basic room, since we'd booked late and the suite wasn't free for our whole trip. The basic room was also very clean and comfortable. The front desk was very helpful with our switching process, making sure we got a new room close to our old one, to make moving our belongings as easy as possible. This isn't the fanciest hotel that I've ever stayed in, but it's clean and comfortable and affordable and the customer service is outstanding, and the location is convenient for all sorts of places in San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Great, nice atmosphere, verry nice staff!!”
Reviews.Author: Jeanette83
Reviews.Content: So nice, great breakfast area, sweet swimming pool, near the old town. You can borrow dvd's which is nice, you can get tea or coffe from the common area to your room. You can BBQ at the pool in the evening. Clean rooms, good shower. Would absolutely go there again!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, and great value for the money”
Reviews.Author: bigfuzzybear
Reviews.Content: Nice little hotel in a central location, albeit just off the highway. Hotel staff are very helpful and friendly. there is also a business center with free printing. There is a nice movie collection if you want to stay in for the night or have kids. breakfast is great - lots of choice, and constantly monitored/replenished by the staff. We had to leave really early when we checked out and the staff made sure to open the dining room for us to have a quick bite. on the other hand, our room was in the older building and farther from the main building, so wifi didnt work. if you go, try to get a room in the main building - apparently it is newly renovated. towels were thin and rough, and we went to the front desk for an extra towel each day, which got annoying. however, we still recommend old town inn - it is a great place for the price!!

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel, location could be better, good breakfast provided!”
Reviews.Author: Oztandl
Reviews.Content: This hotel is just another room - ok but but nothing that stands out. Breakfast is included and is done well, laundry available if required and pool would be useful if there when warm. Location isnt central but close enough to old town san diego. I would concider this hotel if passing through in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for the Price”
Reviews.Author: kelly2137
Reviews.Content: The staff at the Old Town inn is fantastic! Very friendly and accommodating. The breakfast provided in the morning is perfect to get your day going without having to go out as soon as you wake up. The pool looked great, although it ended up being to cold to use while we were there. Thye lobby was very inviting especially when they lit a wood burning fire in the fireplace (too bad we were checking out)! Walking distance to Old Town is great! We did check out one of their free DVDs, but the DVD player died on us and we were not able to watch it. I'm sure they would've come to fix it or change it out, but we just found something else to watch, The computer set up in the lobby with free priniting is a big plus too. The rooms were perfectly clean which is the main thing really. Our only complaint is the way they make the bed with all kinds of sheets every which way. IT loks great for presentation, but not the best for sleeping...too tangled! All in all a great hotel, much less expensive than being on the beach and better in every way than hotel circle. I ahve already recommended to others and we will certainly stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Central though frightening location.”
Reviews.Author: Btj1972
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a family suite strangely with my family on a San Diego zoo excursion. It was wonderful to have so much space refrigerator and amenities top notch two televisions each with DVD player made for easier night, recommends pizza place was fast and passable. Overall great stay. One negative is also a positive central location is central to all sorts of other stuff. Ran over to wal-grens for a forgoten prescription and realized this was a bad neighborhood. Two blocks from adult stores and the airport. Hotel wonderful nearby a bit scary. Good staff and safe feeling oasis-like grounds made it a recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Very friendly staff, good location”
Reviews.Author: MaineBlueberry
Reviews.Content: We stayed here when we were in town for a Padres game. The hotel is right across from a trolley stop that goes directly to and from PETCO Park and downtown, and at $5 for a day pass, much better than parking downtown. We stayed in the economy rooms: nothing too special, but clean, quiet, and a great rate. The staff were friendly and helpful on tourist information, and the breakfast was good (especially liked the fruit).

Reviews.Title: “Very clean, friendly staff, and good location”
Reviews.Author: Salsera713
Reviews.Content: I went to San Diego for a friend's wedding, but made a long weekend out of it. I stayed in Old Town on my first night in town, mainly based on the good reviews here. They did not steer me wrong. The staff at the front desk are very friendly and helpful. The check-in process was a breeze. They have free parking. The hotel room was probably one of the cleanest hotel rooms I've ever stayed in - absolutely spotless. And they paid attention to so many details - it was really well set up and the housekeeping staff puts a personal touch to the place. I was very impressed. The location is good. It's within walking distance of Old Town and right across the street from the bus station and the trolley station, so if you don't have a car or you didn't want to drive, transportation is at your fingertips (well, if your fingertips reached across the street, it would be). Only two things that I wish had been different. The trolley only runs until about midnight (on the weekends), so if you want to go out to the Gas Lamp Quarter and stay out late, you'll have to take a cab back, but it's not far, so this probably wouldn't be expensive. And the breakfast isn't anything special. They do have wheat bread, which I appreciated, and orange juice, but everything else was what you would typically find at a Days Inn / Comfort Inn type breakfast. The price is very reasonable and, overall, I had a great stay. I even got to sit out at the pool for about 30 minutes and soak up some sun (it's not a big pool, but it's cute and well placed). Overall, I would definitely recommend staying here.

Reviews.Title: “It was perfect for us in every aspect.”
Reviews.Author: 154945David
Reviews.Content: The front dest staff were extremely friendly, knowledgeable and helpful to enable us to get around to see the things we wanted to see. They also made some of the arrangements for us. The complimentary breakfast was very good and there was plenty of everything.

Reviews.Title: “Can't beat this value”
Reviews.Author: revtom
Reviews.Content: For a great value on a nice place to stay, I don't think you can beat the Old Town Inn. Walking distance from all of the Old Town attractions (and some outstanding restaurants), and less than a five minute walk to the transportation center for buses and tolleys, the location was amazing. Add to that the friendliness and efficiency of the staff, a very nice continental breakfast and the cleanliness of the rooms, this is just a wonderful motel. It's not the newest or fanciest, but I'm sure it must be the best value out there. (And, for what it's worth, "value" isn't the first thing we usually look for, so this was a big plus!)

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel with great access to Old Town”
Reviews.Author: terina333
Reviews.Content: This hotel is probably a 10minute taxi ride from downtown, it is in an industrial area but the hotel looks so pretty and welcoming, with lovely flowers surrounding the site. Location is good as it was a short walk to Old Town and we got the train to downtown which didn't take very long at all. Reception staff were very friendly and welcoming, our room was fine, it actually had a fridge and microwave in as well, but we didn't use these as we went out to eat. The reception area to the hotel has a lounge area with board games and films to borrow. Also free wireless internet and a computer to use in reception. We enjoyed our stay here and would recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Industrial Spanish Old Town”
Reviews.Author: Roseglasses
Reviews.Content: The Old Town Inn was rated well in TA so we took a chance and we were not disappointed. This is an older facility but it is well maintained - in fact, 3 rooms are in the process of being updated as I write. Contracted workers were extremely courteous and quiet. The Inn is located in an industrial part of town, so the ambiance took a hit - but the close proximity to the airport and walking distance to lovely Old San Diego made this a good location for the last 2 days of our vacation

Reviews.Title: “Very nice property and a great value!”
Reviews.Author: callifuntrvl08
Reviews.Content: This was a very nice property with many flowers growing all around. Nice lobby with computer available for guests. Great breakfast consisting of waffles, hard boiled eggs, toast, pastries, muffins, bagels,. fresh fruit as well as a tropical canned fruit mix, a variety of cereals, juice, milk and coffee, hot chocolate.....Easy walk to Old Town and Restaurants. Movies available to check out. Easy freeway access. Good customer service! Hope to stay here again soon.

Reviews.Title: “These Ladies Could Teach hotel management!!”
Reviews.Author: marialulu
Reviews.Content: We would like to find a place like the Old Town Inn whenever or wherever we travel. they do everything right from the phone reservation, to check in, to helping you get oriented to the city, graciously giving directions and tips, calling taxis, storing luggage, whatever!! The place is good value, our room was spacious and clean, well appointed, no skimping on anything, everything worked, even the clock!! (How often do you have to reset the clock because someone has unplugged it? Kind of an aggravation when you arrive tired and just want to settle in and not figure out how to reset a clock!). The lobby is cozy and welcoming, the breakfast room is bright and well tended, food items restocked as needed, again no skimping on anything. We didn't have time to use the pool area but it is very attractive and well tended also. They even have a free laundry room for guests to use. I can't say enough positive things about this place and the sweet ladies who run it. It's on my radar for any future San Diego visits even if the location is not the most convenient if you are without a car.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Loved It!”
Reviews.Author: xmansmommy
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Old Town Inn from April 7-April 12th. Anna was AWESOME. She made sure to make us feel right at home! The rooms (we had to switch to a bottom floor room...cause of our little one)....both of the rooms were so clean and smelled great! The extra pillows they provide in the rooms were so nice...the bathrooms were clean and fresh towels everyday (with a little one we use alot!!!) was perfect!!! Everyday after a long day of sightseeing and traveling around in/out of town...it was just so nice to come back to the room....it was our home away from home...and it was just plain comfortable! The free breakfast was great too...it really helped not having to pay for breakfast 5 days! The food was fresh (like the waffles) and the fruit was delicious! The landscaping was BEAUTIFUL! My husband and son loved the pool(heated)...it was fun for them to get in and play around while I did laundry...and it was pet friendly...I wish we would have brought our dog! Just a FRIENDLY fun little hotel. Loved it...Overall...I would absolutely stay at the Old Town Inn again...the staff was polite, friendly and ALWAYS helpful! And the price was excellent...we shopped around long and hard before we decided were to stay and we made the best choice with Old Town Inn! We really enjoyed ourselves and hope to make it back to San Diego one day! (P.S. Buy the Zoo and Trolley tickets there at the hotel...every dollar counts...they were able to save us 8 bucks on Zoo tickets...it was just a GREAT deal!! )

Reviews.Title: “What a find!”
Reviews.Author: cslewis112
Reviews.Content: So happy to have found the Old Town Inn. Staff was friendly and helpful from the first phone call to make the reservation to the end of our stay. Charming rooms, nice and clean. A short walk to Old Town shops and centrally located to the numerous interesting districts in San Diego. Will certainly come back!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel for Families!”
Reviews.Author: kids_on_the_road_11
Reviews.Content: Our family of 5 stayed in a Family Suite from April 6th-9th. The Family Suite was large and allowed us to cook some meals in our room. The kitchen includes a small refridgerator, two burner stove and microwave. There is a dining table that seats three. The beds were comfortable and the room was very clean. There was a good deal of construction noise due to sewer repair work directly behind our room, and the hotel staff discounted our room as a result. There is free wifi, but the connection speed is very slow and I received a much faster connection using my the Verizon network on my 3G smartphone. We took advantage of the free DVDs in the lobby and the continental breakfast daily. We enjoyed the location close to Old Town and Seaworld. We will definitely consider staying here in the future when visiting San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for the location.”
Reviews.Author: rayandgabby
Reviews.Content: my fiance, 4 y.o. Daughter, and I stayed here on a completely unplanned roadtrip down to SD. We had just gone on a trip a few weeks prior so we werent looking to spend a lot of $. Anyway, gave this place a call and booked a room for ninety bucks which was a king bed and a rollout for my daughter... The room was nothing fancy, pretty basic, but they do have some ammenities which make it standout. They let u check out dvds as well as games from the lobby. This was great for my daughter who I played a game of jenga with and watched shrek before bed... Also the location is within walking distance to old town, which is one of our favorite attractions in SD. also the breakfast was pretty decent. Bagels, waffles, hard boiled eggs, toast, fruit, oatmeal, cereal, coffee, juice... Other than that I did notice the pool which we did not have time to jump in..plus I noticed they have an arcade game down by the lobby which was pretty interesting. The front desk lady was also very polite so no issue there. Now the only problem was that the motel was apparently renovating the rooms to be non smoking, but ours did smell pretty strongly of cigarette smoke. that was the only minor complaint and will hopefully be fixed in the near future. Overall, I would definitely recomend.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommend, very friendly/helpful, clean”
Reviews.Author: familytraveler2222
Reviews.Content: Very nice staff. Anytime we had questions or needed something they were always willing to help. They new the area and the best places to go. Rooms were clean and nice. Highly recommend to anyone traveling to San Diego, especially with kids.

Reviews.Title: “Very convenient nice place and very reasonably priced”
Reviews.Author: herendeyr
Reviews.Content: Family stayed at Old Town Inn from 4/1 - 4/3 and enjoyed our stay. We arrived an hour prior to the 3pm checkin and with the nice day our girls took a swim in the nice pool. We saw the BBQ grill in the corner and thought it was nice to have available, but unfortunately we ate out all the time since the hotel was conveniently close to the historical part of old town. Anna helped us out at checkin and pointed out on the map how there was a pedestrian tunnel underneath the railway station that would get us quickly to that part of old town. Taking note of the time on my watch it took no more than 5 minutes to get there. Our main reason for being in San Diego was to also go to Seaworld which was about a 10 minute surface street drive from the hotel. Back at the hotel we enjoyed the extras they provided such as a bookcase selection of DVDs guests can borrow along with a variety of board games and books which guests can enjoy in the lobby where there were couches to relax in or take back to their rooms. It was also convenient that they had a guest computer in the lobby, but we used the free wi-fi from the room and had no problems. Also it was nice that in the lobby they always had coffee and ice cold lemon water available. Then of course in the morning there was the continental breakfast in the dining room next to the lobby. Nice to have your own freshly cooked waffles in the morning with their good coffee. The hotel staff were all friendly and helpful. The room was very neat and with the granite counters for the two sinks added a nice touch. The bed was probably the most comfortable hotel bed I've slept in as I slept all night without the tossing and turning I usually experience at other hotels. The room was well maintained, but the only negative for any of this review was the fact that there was the smell of cigarette smoke every time we entered the room (although the sign on the door as with all their rooms show 'non-smoking'). As much as I prefer to conserve electricity I found that having the AC on helped keep the smoke smell away. I was told that all the rooms are undergoing some improvements and changing them to all be non-smoking so perhaps they hadn't completely gotten to the room we stayed in on the 3rd floor across from the lobby. Other than that if there was a reason to go back to San Diego we would definitely stay at Old Town Inn and hopefully next time get a room without the smoke smell.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect, home away from home!”
Reviews.Author: thawsout
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in fall & summer while my daughter attends SDSU; now I'm staying in spring for her graduation and I will happily return during her grad. school time. I love the quiet, clean, very comfortable rooms, garden, good breakfast, tea, coffee, cocoa & cold water available, cozy lobby area with library & internet computer to use there; even movies to loan. U am very grateful that they have free ice :-) & I also appreciate it's location near Old Town & trolley & a short drive to all else. Perhaps the best is the staff, most friendly & helpful of anywhere I've stayed & they will go out of their way to help (right Mary?). I highly recommend it for singles (I felt completely safe on my week's stay on my own or with my daughter, as well as the couple's get away, families and couples and have enjoyed these experiences equally. Thank you again for making me feel at home. SDSU Mom

Reviews.Title: “This is the place your looking for....”
Reviews.Author: razorback98
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were traveling with our children on a Saturday night looking for a room. We had been traveling for 12 hours and couldn't decide in a room in Laguna or Newport beach because we wanted the kids to get to swim. We decided to give up finding a place to swim after a long day due to location and prices. We were shooting for under a hundred on our non Disney days to help with budget. We decided just to head down to San Diego since we were going to seaworld and the zoo. I called Old town inn after 8 and found the place we needed. Got a good deal we were coming in late . We made it in time to swim also. The room was very clean and spacious. It was very clean as was the lobby. They have free DVDs to watch in room. They also have a bunch of board games. So , if you have children pretty good setup. Breakfast was pretty good. Three different cereals, various pastries/muffins, boiled eggs, fruit,coffee, orange juice, and make your own waffles. Location was great for the zoo, seaworld, and Old Town. It is across from a storage/warehouse but still great location. They have discounted tickets for Seaworld and SDZoo. It's $4 off a ticket. Went to stay one day and within 30 minutes of arriving , I booked for Sunday night also. We would not stay anywhere else when we return to San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “All in all, it was perfect. I loved my stay here.”
Reviews.Author: lmcgregor
Reviews.Content: I went to San Diego to celebrate an event in my life and unfortunately had to go alone as something came up for my traveling companion. I chose the Old Town Inn because of the Trip Advisor review and because it was very close to the trolleys at Old Town. I expected that would be very helpful to go everywhere I wanted to go without having to take a taxi. I was so right! Five minute walk to the trolley and the Coaster and everwhere was within my reach. The staff was really helpful and very friendly. There is a wonderful continental breakfast each morning and the pool is beautiful. Coffee, tea, and lemon water was available in the front lobby all day. No hot tub but that was the ONLY thing that was missing. Rooms were clean and bright. I would definitely recommend the Old Town Inn to anyone who wants a good vacation, great service and does not want to spend a fortune on accomodations. Thanks to all the staff for making my stay very memorable.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful choice!”
Reviews.Author: memarac
Reviews.Content: My mother, daughter and I all had a wonderful time in this small but very nicely landscaped motel. The front desk was very friendly, the breakfast was adequate and free and the room was very comfortable. They have limited wifi throughout and a computer in the lobby. You can also borrow dvd's because every room has a player.`

Reviews.Title: “Convenient and Affordable”
Reviews.Author: TeresaSammis
Reviews.Content: We had a two night stay in this locally owned hotel and enjoyed our stay. It was a short walk to Old Town and the trolley, which is one of the reasons we chose this venue. The breakfast was the typical continental fare, but better stocked and fresher than many I've seen. The pool ares was nicely landscaped and clean. The lobby was very nice with a fire in the fireplace which was cozy. (And needed. It got cold while we were there.) We stayed in one of the older rooms, which was immaculate. The weather had turned in San Diego and we got in late, and were cold that first night, so asked for extra blankets which they cheerfully provided. Probably the only downside, which was specific to our room, was we were right on the street with a wall of windows so got a lot of traffic noise. I think one room in from us was a lot quieter. So we'd stay there again, but probably ask for a different room. The staff was exceptional and helpful to us. Overall, a great bargain, immaculate and convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Just as advertised”
Reviews.Author: RMillerLosAngeles
Reviews.Content: After reading numerous reviews we decided to book this hotel for its value and there was no disappointment. With a AAA discount we stayed a Sat nite for $ 100 in a room that was very clean and had all the amenities we needed. The beds were very tidy and comfortable, and although the room wasn't large it didn't feel cramped, and was laid out very efficiently. Particularly useful was that there sinks in different areas so that both of us could get ready at the same time without interfering with each other. Noise levels were quite good too. Staff at the front desk and in the breakfast room were very friendly and helpful. They gave us good guidance on attractions, and sold us Zoo tickets for a slight discount ($ 4 off regular price). That saved standing in line to get tickets at the Zoo. Of course, considering the price there are some compromises to make when staying at Old Town Inn. One is that there is no restaurant or bar on site. Another is that there are no tourist attractions, restaurants, bars, groceries/drugstores in walking distance. You can't get into Old Town itself (despite the name) because you have to cross a 4 lane highway.. However, the location is very central for reaching San Diego's main attractions by car (Zoo, Midway, Botanical Gardens, Old Town, Coronado, Petco Park, Gaslight area, LaJolla etc). All within 15-20 minutes drive. The only other downside is the lack of an exercise facility although they do have a nice swimming pool. They don't have a separate "Business Center" room but they do have a computer and printer in an area near the front desk so that you can run off boarding passes and/or maps. Given all that, Old Town Inn would not be an ideal place for an extended stay because of its lack of certain amenities and the inability to easily walk out and get them nearby (like a restaurant or bar).. On the other hand, for a quick 1-2 night stay where you don't plan to spend much time at the hotel and only want clean, efficient, pleasantly decorated rooms , helpful service, and a convenient location for driving to points in San Diego at a very reasonable price, this place can't be beat....

Reviews.Title: “You won't find a better value”
Reviews.Author: belwah1
Reviews.Content: This is our third year of staying here. The last two years we've stayed there for two weeks. Pretty hard to find any faults with this operation. Their people are top notch, they care and if you have a problem or a request it's taken care of. Maintenance and cleanliness seem to be a priority. The location near the junction of Interstates 5 & 8 makes it easy to get to all the major tourist attractions. Their breakfast room is one of the nicer that we've been in. Their lobby with fireplace is nice place to sit and enjoy. Finally, their price strucure is very competitive.

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to return - enjoy a luxurious, romantic, relaxing retreat again!”
Reviews.Author: BSheddy
Reviews.Content: We thoroughly enjoyed our anniversary vacation at the Old Town Inn. It was perfect as only one half hour from home and yet we felt a million miles away. The staff was friendly and welcoming. We loved our luxurious room with private spa and fireplace. Yet a block away we had numerous restaurants, fun shops and plenty of tourist attractions to keep us busy. Especially enjoyable was the delicious breakfast of fresh cooked waffles with fruit and syrup as well as assorted breakfast items to start the day. We can't wait until our next anniversary so we can go back to peace and relaxation, enjoying a break from the hectic routine to celebrate our married life together. We highly recommend this hotel!!!

Reviews.Title: “No absolutely cheap, but a very good deal”
Reviews.Author: Fraianeli
Reviews.Content: I stayed one weekend in this hotel and enjoyed it very much. The lady that was at the balcon started talking to me like I was stupid, I don't know if it's because she realized that I was not American, or because she usually speaks like. Depsite this fact, she gave me a few hints on how to go to some landmarks (they give one paper with instructions on how to use public transportation to go to landmarks) and a few facts about the hotel. Speaking of going to places, the location of the hotel is great, because it is in a 5 minute walking distance to one of the blue line stations. The only very small flaw, is that there are not many signs telling where is the hotel, so if you're on your first time, you might turn in the wrong direction. The rooms were clean. I wouldn't say the bathroom was impecably clean, but it was in good conditions. The rest of the hotel seemed very clean too. The rooms were good and the beds confortable. The TV didn't have a good quality of image, so the hotel lost points there. And finally, the price was fair considering local prices and hotel qualities, but still not very low if you're on a budget.In this case, maybe you can forget some of its advantages and look for a cheaper hotel

Reviews.Title: “A good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ozziebren
Reviews.Content: I stayed at The Old Town Inn because of Trip advisor.I was told the Bus and Trolley service was just across the road. I didn't have a car, so it was great for me to get around San Diego.For $5 a day I went everywhere.From the Beach to the Zoo,even to the Border of Mexico. The hotel was very clean, the room comfortable, and the coffee machine in the room was great for my early morning coffee.My room over looking the pool.The breakfast was very good and set me up for the day of sight seeing.The staff were very helpful.They had lemon water,tea and coffee all day in the lounge for guest.There was also a computer for guest to use.I will be staying here again if I ever go to San Diego again.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant, effiecient staff and clean and cozy facilities”
Reviews.Author: WildflowerWatcher
Reviews.Content: We selected the Old Town Inn based on reviews on TripAdvisor and weren't disappointed. We booked the 'Managers Special' - stay 5 nights get two free, which really made the Inn a bargain rate. We stayed in an 'economy' room, which was smallish but perfectly adequate and very clean. The breakfast was better than I've had at pricier places and the woman who staffed the breakfast room on Sunday, Feb. 20 was amazing. The place was packed and she efficiently, effectively, and pleasantly replenished everything constantly. Staff was very helpful and friendly. The Inn is also conveniently located. Getting anywhere was easy and they have a sheet of excellent directions to get you places. We also bought our discounted zoo tickets there too. I'd stay there again. You do hear traffic but you're in a city.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great price, great staff!”
Reviews.Author: dee715
Reviews.Content: Our first trip to San Diego and did not know area. Could not have picked a better location. Across the hwy from Old Town, 2-3 block walk to transportation center that will take you everywhere and convenient to shopping (you need a car) and a drive up to LaJolla. Very good breakfast, clean and comfortable room and free parking and internet. The only drawback I could see would be that it's located on a main highway by the airport. Would highly recommend and will definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice pre-cruise”
Reviews.Author: KsW_MD
Reviews.Content: Stayed her overnight before cruise out of San Diego. Comfortable rooms. Service good. Breakfast good. Parking good. Free internet access. We like the shopping nearby. Car is required to enjoy fully. Short cab ride to airport. Public Transit downtown starts over the street in Old Town itself. Good choice and value for our purpose. This was our 3rd stay here.

Reviews.Title: “comforts of home away from home”
Reviews.Author: joe geography
Reviews.Content: This is our third stay @ Old Town Inn. The staff are cordial and eager to make guests as comfortable as possible. The facility, though not new, has been very well maintained and updated as needed. The rooms in the cottages are small but have everything we needed. Our room was always spotless when we returned each day. The grounds are beautifully planted and well tended. The water in the swim pool was sparkling clear and inviting. The continental breakfast each morning was a bonus. We have recommended the Old Town Inn to our friends.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient spot, close to transportation”
Reviews.Author: CalgaryWill
Reviews.Content: We stayed there a few nights before taking a cruise from San Diego. The place is really convenient to highways and commuter trains, so you can get around easily. We had a queen room with mini-fridge and microwave so we could handle a few meals on our own. The room was large as well. Excellent breakfast included as well. Includes fruit, Danish, muffins, bagels, cold boiled eggs, plus usual stuff.

Reviews.Title: “super happy place”
Reviews.Author: tomatocfa
Reviews.Content: july of this year will be my 10th year staying at this hotel before finding this place i stayed at a few hotels on sports arena blvd.the hotel staff was ok but they didnt meaure up to the likeness and curtious standards of the those two outstanding managers beatriz and anna USTODES SON MUY LINDAS CONMIGO not to mention the rest of the friendly staff .i've read preveious reviews on this hotel and iam most overwhelmingly flabbergasted about some of these negative reviews this hotel has gotten.when i stayed at the hotels on sports arena blvd you had walk at least a mile to get to the trolley station. even though his hotel is located in an industrial community it is directly across the street from the old town trolley station no more than a 10 minute walk.the environs of this hotel may tend to somewhat noisy from the traffic however i been through worser areas where the noise was intensesingly more un bearable...ive even seen this hotel in a you tube video clip just recently. overall i could be no more happier staying here when i come to san diego .god bless all of you at the old town inn.

Reviews.Title: “Peaceful, relaxing place to stay”
Reviews.Author: kanah56
Reviews.Content: I've come two years in a row with my Church group. The rooms are meticulously clean and comfortable, and the kitchen and lounge are too, with a beautiful pool. Old Town is an easy walk and so is the trolley and bus. Nights are very quiet- easy to sleep!

Reviews.Title: “SCC Retreat”
Reviews.Author: Ralphs
Reviews.Content: We were welcomed upon our arrival by very pleasant helpful Registration personnel.The rooms are spacious; clean the beds are very comfortable. Our group required a meeting place and we had at our disposal a large dining area. Since we were having a BBQ both Saturday afternoon and evening we were given the outside BBQ area with a pool off the main kitchen. Utinsels were made available for our use. The full breakfast consisted of boiled eggs; make your own waffles; toast; and bagels. There were various fruits and sweet rolls available plus coffee and milk for cereals. We felt very welcomed and at home and will no doubt be back next year.

Reviews.Title: “A peaceful, relaxing experience!”
Reviews.Author: Spiritwood
Reviews.Content: A group of parishioners from our church stayed here overnight and enjoyed excellent customer service! We met in the breakfast room, watched a video on the big screen TV, BBQ'd on the new grill in the pool area and then went to our rooms for a great night sleep! We met the next morning in the breakfast room and enjoyed the free breakfast and then met to close our week-end experience in a family suite. This is our second year here for this gathering and we will definitely be back again next year! Don't miss this shining gem in Old Town!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Room”
Reviews.Author: mattandliz803
Reviews.Content: My fiancee and I stayed here for one night last Saturday (Jan 22, 2011). We've never been to San Diego and wanted to go on a short trip to see the zoo. We found this place online and thought it looked perfect. We got to San Diego sooner than we expected and were allowed to check in at 10am instead of the standard 3pm check in since the room was ready and that was great. We stayed in their one Jacuzzi Suite and it was amazing. It's a single level, spacious room. It is very unique and comfortable. The bed was comfortable. It had a big flat screen tv and a couch. It had a rainfall shower and of course, a giant jacuzzi tub with jets and many settings. It also had a fireplace that you can turn on by a switch. The room felt safe and we had plenty of privacy. The room had a DVD player and we checked out a DVD from the lobby (for free) that we enjoyed after our long day out. The breakfast had plenty of options and we were very satisfied. Overall, our stay was fantastic. The room was relaxing and private and one of a kind and we will be returning to this Inn the next time we're in San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Died and Went to Heaven”
Reviews.Author: jwprice
Reviews.Content: Last week I felt I was in Heaven. I was in San Diego at the Old Town Inn. Sunny, cloudless skies, 70 degrees, palm trees, and a nice quiet pool. While my first time there was great. the hotel I feel is not for the corporate crowd needing a 4G WiFi network. The premises are very well kept up. Staff is very helpful (Rebecca at the front desk answered all my dumb questions with charm and patience.) There is a varied (standard) breakfast, which allows you to pick whatever you like. I stayed in one of the economy bungalow units; next time I'll go for the newer wing. BTW - if you want a big breakfast, go to Perry's Cafe 2 blocks north. I would go elsewhere for lunch and dinner.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, friendly service, comfortable rooms”
Reviews.Author: pickyjimmy
Reviews.Content: this is the first time using trip advisor to pick a hotel. I was glad I did. This hotel is convienently located just 7 minutes from Sea World. We were able to buy our tickets from the hotel and they were cheaper than buying them at the park. The rooms are clean and comfortable. Breakfast is included, which is great because you save $20 right there. They also have DVD players in all the rooms with DVD's you can borrow from the hotel. The staff is very attentive and friendly. I was going to stay only 1 night, just in case, but ended up staying for all 3 nights I was in town.

Reviews.Title: “the best customer service at any hotel i have stayed at”
Reviews.Author: bonnie999
Reviews.Content: my husband and i stayed at the old town inn in october. they were the nicest and most accomodating staff i have ever encountered. they were helpful from drugstore items i forgot, to letting my husband watch the football game after checkout before our cab took us to the airport. it was so convienent to the transportation that when we go back ( and we will!!!) we would definately stay there again and not bother with a car again. everything worked out better than i could have imagined.

Reviews.Title: “A perfect stay.”
Reviews.Author: SweetBee77
Reviews.Content: We loved the Old Town Inn. It's within walking distance to Old Town and within a few minutes' drive of downtown San Diego so we were never far from the things we wanted to do. The staff was incredibly helpful and responsive whenever we had a question or needed something. The breakfast was good (make-your-own waffles) and our room was perfect. It had a small kitchen, as well as a couch and TV area complete with cable TV and a DVD player. The hotel even lets you "rent" top-notch DVDs for free (as opposed to the last place I stayed, where we paid $14.99 to watch a movie and $4.99 to watch a TV show). Overall, a great experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place To Stay”
Reviews.Author: katieb4m
Reviews.Content: We came down for our sons graduation from the Marines. We had 2 rooms and stayed 3 nights. The rooms are very clean and the bed are very comfortable. Could of used another blanket and I'm sure they had them but I didn't not ask. The rooms are very clean. The hotel staff is very friendly. The breakfast was good. When you first get there the neighborhood looks a little iffy BUT we felt safe and it's really close to MCRD and other stores. We are so glad we stayed here. I will recommend this to my friends who's son's are at MCRD right now. Thank you Old Town Inn for a great stay!!

Reviews.Title: “Smoke blowing in through bathroom vent”
Reviews.Author: fivehappytravellers
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with friend and asked for non smoking room. We were put in a dark room, under stairwell that had no view of anything except stairs. room was fairly clean but I think the staff smoking area must have been behind our room because cigarette smoke came in through our bathroom vent all night! We turned the fan on, but it didn't help much. * breakfast was great, but big line up. Fresh fruit salad was a bonus. * pool was clean(didn't swim though) * staff were nice *the area the hotel is situated in is quite seedy Overall, my friends and I agreed that we would stay here again if we had a room on the second floor and away from smoking areas.

Reviews.Title: “More Than we Expected”
Reviews.Author: vestor42
Reviews.Content: Long ago Holiday Inn advertised "The Best Surprise is no Surprise" This Inn disproved the slogan. The surprise was for the best. I had good recomendations but they were short of what we got. It was perfect in every way. Truly a joy to stay at and I will definately stay there every time I am in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: sgilless
Reviews.Content: Hotel is very reasonably prices and conveniently located close to the Old Town, and the corresponding trolley station. However, it does not lie at all in the Old Town. Rather, it lies very close to the 24h noisy highway I5. This is the only drawback I could find. Other than that, the rooms, breakfast, etc is pretty standard; but the price compared to other hotels is very good.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, accessible location, iffy neighborhood â€¦”
Reviews.Author: J13345
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Old Town Inn for 2 nights while attending a work-related conference at the San Diego Convention Center (SDCC). I stayed at less than half the rate of a hotel within walking distance to the SDCC and even with the SDCC parking ($10). The OTI is slightly less than 10 minute drive on surface streets to the CC and about 2 blocks to Old Town San Diego. The neighborhood looks iffy mostly because it appears to be largely industrial rather than commercial or residential â€¦ also the trash, the liquor stores, and the wandering homeless. Personally, I wouldnâ€™t stay here without a vehicle because there isnâ€™t anything besides Old Town I would want to walk to. The property however stand out all the more because of the environs â€“ it is well kept and well lit. Plenty of parking right in front of the rooms. Access to San Diego is good since it is located right on Pacific Highway which leads straight to the harbor and downtown. The other way is the Sports Arena area where there are quite a few restaurants, shops, lumber store, etc and of course the Sports Arena. It is a little awkward getting to the motel from Pacific Highway since it is a south bound one way so if you are coming north up Pacific you probably want to turn left at Kurtz then right on Rosecrans and right again on Pacific. The airport is really close but not so close so as you are bothered by the sounds of aircraft. The motel is at the junction of the 5 and the 8 Freeways. If youâ€™re interested take a look at the management response of September 20, 2010 â€“ gives a little bit of history and context if its authentic. My experience was overall favorable. No problems with my reservations or with check-in. You get a nice hospitality pack with your check-in materials and the staff was friendly and efficient. My room (a non-smoking queen) was tidy and did not smell of cigarettes. The TV had fewer cable channels than some other hotels with similar price range but they have a library of DVDs in the lobby you can watch for free on the DVD player in your room. My room had a small refrigerator and microwave. Also a coffee maker with coffee packets, hair dryer, iron, and ironing board. I noticed that each day one towel, the first tissue paper, and toilet paper ends were folded in some kind of origami decoration â€“ a nice touch especially considering it must have taken somebody some extra time to fold and plait the stuff. My bed was kinda soft but not a problem. Both nights the locale had no other noises than the occasional train in the distance and a little bit of freeway rumble. The breakfast area was clean and bright. The complimentary breakfast includes waffles you make yourself, a variety of pastries, bagels, toast, boiled eggs, oatmeal, cereal, fruit, coffee and tea. Not exactly hearty fare but, you know, itâ€™s healthier that way. I noted that on the morning I checked out that the bagels were hard enough to knock out fillings (i.e. stale) â€“ just a warning. Observing my fellow travelers at breakfast, I would guess they were mostly families on trips of some kind rather than business travel but you never know. This is my kind of place meaning functional and value â€“ not the place anybody would run away to in order to â€œpop the question,â€� spice their marriage, or maybe ruin their marriage. Iâ€™m not exactly certain I would stay here again except if I were attending another work event at the Convention Center and needed to save money and I wouldnâ€™t want to stay here without a vehicle. Overall, my stay was positive and I found the place a great value for being so close and accessible to San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Best place to stay when in SD”
Reviews.Author: BadDadFun
Reviews.Content: We think this is a great find when looking for a place to stay in San Diego. This fit our budget well. We can't say enough nice things about this charming place. The service was great, everyone was very helpful. The prices were great they have three types of rooms, all well within everyoneâ€™s budget and well under $100.00 per night. They have a small pool decorated with lots of flowers. Also available the lobby had movies (DVDs) that we were able to check out. They had drinks (coffee, tea and water) available all day long in the lobby. In the morning they had a nice breakfast buffet that included a make your own waffle. The beds were very comfy. A great place for anyone be it a family or a couple, and cheaper than a motel six. Don't let the neighborhood derail you. It was very quiet area of town even with the train and tram next door. A very nice thing about this hotel was it is next to the tram and bus station. For our week stay we used this system to get around and left our car behind, what a nice way to see San Diego. Yes, we would stay here again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - Great Location”
Reviews.Author: tspencer37
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at The Old Town Inn. Its about 2 blocks from Old Town. Its very easy to walk to Old Town from the hotel. We felt very safe in the area. The free breakfast was beyond our expectations. We recieved a welcome pack when we checked in along with coupons and maps of Old Town and of San Diego. Everyone who worked there was very friendly. We stayed there for 5 nights. Our room was on the second floor. The king bed was fantastic and the room was well maintained. Our son lives in San Diego and we plan on staying there from now on when we visit. Tim Spencer

Reviews.Title: “Keep coming back because it's a vacation oasis even when i'm not on vacation!”
Reviews.Author: lizard2158
Reviews.Content: Once again we chose to stay at OT Inn for a business conference and despite San Diego's unpredictable weather, the always very friendly staff is more than happy to have a fire going in their cozy lobby if it's even slightly cool outside. Or serving the refreshing lemon water when the temp picks up. Rooms always wonderfully clean, and LOVE the over abundance of the wonderful down pillows! ~ Could take in the beautiful landscape outside the window all day. Lastly, the delicious breakfast is always a big hit and we find it amazing ths is complimentary for the variety that is offered!! .

Reviews.Title: “this the the place to stay, what a hidden gem !”
Reviews.Author: blueyedgirl1022
Reviews.Content: I think this is a great find when looking to stay in San Diego on a budget. I just got back and I can't say enough nice things aobut this charming hidden gem. The service was great everyone was just so helpful. We were even given a coupon for a free dessert at Freds in old town anda welcome pack on arrival.. The prices were great they have three types of rooms, all well within everyones budget and well under $100.00 per night. A verty pretty charming pool are with lots of flowers and a bbq . Also available the lobby had movies that we were able to check out , coffe, tea and a mint water were available all day. In the morning they had a really nice breakfast buffet that included a waffle making experience that was both fun and yummy. The beds were very comfy and our room even had a small frig and a pullout couch/ bed. A great place for anyone be it a family or a couple, and cheaper than a motel six. Don't let the neighborhood derail you. I would stay here again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific value”
Reviews.Author: Bea962
Reviews.Content: I was dismayed at first as we didn't have a car but with what we saved staying there we could easily hop into a cab (always obligingly called by the friendly, helpful reception staff). Free computer use, lavish breakfast buffet (eggs and fruit as well as cereals and waffles), small but sparkling pool, guest laundry, all day hot and cold drinks in lobby, spacious, clean room with loads of room for husband in wheelchair - this was an oasis after the pricey mid-town hotels we had been staying in. We walked to the Old Town for a superb Mexican lunch on the hottest day on record and used our stay to relax. Top marks to staff.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value, excellent service”
Reviews.Author: GBQ
Reviews.Content: If you have a car, this motel is a very good choice. Its location further out of downtown is not a problem as the Pacific Highway gets you downtown in less than 10 minutes. Walking distance to Old Town and Transit Centre. But most important, the service and value are outstanding. You can even borough DVDs for free! Complimentary breakfast is great and staff is extremely pleasant. Our neighbors were noisy, and the walls were thins, but I guess you can be unlucky that way in any other motels or hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Lots of positives and only one minor negative”
Reviews.Author: RACEY101
Reviews.Content: Positives:- Hotel is well located and is just a short walk from Old Town with it's many attractions and dining options. The reception staff are extremely patient, pleasant and helpful. They provide complimentary tea, coffee, iced water in reception throughout the day.The rooms are a good size, nicely furnished and very clean. Unsolicited, we were actually offered an upgrade on our rooms by the owner when he saw the amount of luggage we had. Negative:- Although there is plenty to eat , the breakfast lacks variety, especially if you don't want sweet things ie waffles, cakes,pastries. Overall:- The owner and staff really seem to care about their customers and we would certainly recommend the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Strange location but good and cheap”
Reviews.Author: MelbourneBertie
Reviews.Content: We were a little worried when we first saw the location of the Old Town Inn but had our doubts quickly eased by the front desk staff's friendly service. It's not a dangerous area but the motel's industrial surroundings give it a slightly iffy feel. It's close to the historic Old Town district and within walking distance of public transport and major roads. Our room was small but not cramped, clean, and the bed was comfortable. The buffet breakfast was plentiful with a reasonable variety of options. Free internet on the computer in the lobby was a plus not included at many more expensive hotels.

Reviews.Title: “The right place for the right price”
Reviews.Author: KarMar10
Reviews.Content: The Inn is centrally located and within an easy 2 block walking distance to Old Town; however, is not on the pretty side of the tracks (is not in Old Town). That makes the prices right. Staff is friendly and helpful, the place is nicely landscaped, and the rooms clean and very comfortable. We opted for the economy rooms in the older portion of the motel. They had character, were updated, with great showers, but not a lot of surplus space. That's fine as we were out and about sightseeing for the vast majority of the day, and did not hang around long. Breakfast was included, was more than fine, but was not fancy. And there were no additional charges for parking as we saw on a lot of SD motels / hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful cozy setting with very helpful, generous & courteous employees”
Reviews.Author: Gina45888
Reviews.Content: It is centraly located in the heart of San Diego. You are 5 min. from Downtown, Point Loma, OB, Mission Beach......so many wonderful places to see and do and the hotel is like an oasis tropical setting. Pool setting is very clean and beautiful too! The breakfast that is served for free has a wide variety of choices to choose from too. Homemade waffles, bagels, cereal, muffins, O.J. coffee and lovely lemon water. This is my second stay at the hotel the first was w/my family and now with my girlfriend. I will definitely be back soon!!

Reviews.Title: “Would only stay here in San Diego”
Reviews.Author: luckyamerica36
Reviews.Content: This was the 3rd year running staying at the Old Town Inn,nothing new to say,rooms spotless,Anna on the front desk is fantastic,great breakfast,lovely pool area,great sleep quality.What more could one want?When visiting San Diego we would not stay anywhere else.Keep up the good work!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful for the price”
Reviews.Author: amz1
Reviews.Content: My Fiance and I have just returned from a weeks stay at the Old Town Inn. We certainly have no complaints . The location is excellent for getting to the beaches and downtown as its just across the road from the transit centre. Quite rightly it is on an industrial estate but it didn't bother us. I'm not sure how anyone can say it's not close to the old town, it's just across the road! The grounds of the hotel and the rooms are very clean. The only small complaint i woud have about the rooms is that there isn't a fridge. However, they do provide a plastic container in the room to fill with ice to keep your wine cool! The hotel staff have to be the most helpful I have ever come across. I asked them many questions about public transport etc, and they never got annoyed and would ring the bus company or look online in order to help me out. Other nices touches to the hotel are that you are given a nice selection of travel toiletries upon arrival and the free coffee in the reception is also good. The breakfast was also great!

Reviews.Title: “Would highly recommend for anyone who wants to spend their money on fun, not fancy.”
Reviews.Author: PlainOleTraveler
Reviews.Content: We stayed here with extended family during a Marine Corps Graduation. (3rd generation, including both parents!) It was a great value, albeit strange-sounding location. All weirdness aside (yes, this place in sandwiched between a highway - we heard nothing - and an industrial area) we were truly within walking distance to Old Town, even for someone who is normally fairly paranoid about cities and crime. In fact, we checked the crime map and most of the local crime is from a nearby street and involved inebriated servicemembers. I'm OK with that. We were in a room with a mini-stovetop, microwave and fridge. Perfect if you want to spend your money on fun and events, not eating in a restaurant for every meal. This wouldn't be a hotel for someone who wants to spend $2-3 hundred a night for luxury accommodations. This would be a great hotel for someone who wants a convenient, great value hotel room. If you're in San Diego to do something other than sit in a hotel, seriously consider The Old Town Inn.

Reviews.Title: “Not in Old Town!”
Reviews.Author: ArtWalkingLen
Reviews.Content: Despite its name, this hotel is not in Old Town, nor is it very close. It is in a very noisy location (by a busy hwy and train line), there are no restaurants nearby, or anywhere to go at night. The rooms were aging (hair drying broken, A/C very noisy), and the pool does not include a hot tub, etc. The wireless internet worked most of the time, but the 3rd party provider was rude when I did have problems.

Reviews.Title: “Small, smelly, dingy room”
Reviews.Author: Estepa536
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in july, I am not sure why everybody rates this place. The room we stayed in was small, dingy and stunk of sweat. The room was very dated, plumbing was very noisy and the TV hardly worked. We had a small kitchen which was very dated and the fridge looked like it was from the 60s. The breakfast was okay but nothing special. The sofa bed was very uncomfortable. The staff were okay but I would not recommend this motel to anybody.

Reviews.Title: “Nice find. Clean, cozy and central to everything”
Reviews.Author: Steve1602
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the Jacuzzi suite just before Labor Day weekend. Friendly staff, hot breakfast, quiet, clean and comfortable. There is only one Jacuzzi suite which is a double size room. Fireplace, jetted jacuzzi, flat panel tv, etc. Central to downtown, point loma, sea world, mission valley, old town, la jolla, etc. I am sensitive to noise at night, but all was quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, nice breakfast, but cramped and too much money, and everything timed and lights went out, fan timed out etc”
Reviews.Author: lynnrosas
Reviews.Content: 1. Was clean and the breakfast they offer was decent and good 2. The lights went out went taking a shower 3. The fans (which we like to sleep with on) would not stay on and was on a timer 4. Room cramped, no where really to put things in the bath room As I said it was clean, the people friendly, the breakfast good but it was way too much money for this hotel/motel. I have gotten rooms on other trips way less for the buck, but generally I must give it a good review as they were clean, nice, and the food was good for the breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Not much. Yuck”
Reviews.Author: Megwit
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed here in July. Outside exterior next to a loud busy highway, no view. Please keep looking.

Reviews.Title: “very happy with our choice”
Reviews.Author: gjoan
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Old Town Inn for one night on Aug. 16. We chose this location after reading the reviews on how close it was to the trolley station. We had planned to take the trolley that evening to a concert. We had absolutely no hesitation about walking from the trolley back to the hotel at night. Everything is very well lighted, and it really is not much farther than walking to the parking lot at the trolley. We stayed in one of the economy rooms, and everything was very clean, and more than met out needs. The staff was extremely friendly, and there is coffee and newspapers available in the lobby all of the time. The breakfast was great!

Reviews.Title: “I love the pillowtop mattress!”
Reviews.Author: GreenThumb1978
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Old Town Inn last month, and I can't believe that other reviews actually said that they found it to be uncomfortable. They have the most comfortable pillowtop mattresses, and I had a hard time dragging myself out of bed when it came time to check out of my room. I stayed in one of the deluxe rooms, and I think if you're planning to spend a lot of time in your room while you're on vacation, it's probably worth it to pay the extra to stay in the deluxe rooms over the economy rooms. I saw one of the economy rooms, and while it was perfectly nice, it just wasn't as spacious as the room I stayed in. The sink/vanity area outside the bathroom in the deluxe rooms is huge! I also had a sofa/seating area, which was the perfect spot to have our dinner of pizza and popcorn while we watched a movie. The tv also swivels, so when we decided to hop into bed, we swiveled it from facing the sofa to face the bed instead. The location is a little different, but compared to the prices of the hotels that are actually in the Old Town state park, their prices were a pretty significant savings. The road the hotel is on is kind of busy during the day, but the rooms don't face toward the street, and the landscaping and pool are so pleasant that you don't really notice the street after you've been there a little while, and the traffic really dies down at night, and you don't really hear the traffic if you're in your room, and I had no problem sleeping at all. The staff is very accomodating, and the place has quite a few nice little touches that you don't see at other hotels in their price range. The way they do their towels is pretty cool, and they even have a nifty little way of folding the end of the toilet paper roll... (you have to see it for yourself). Anyway, I enjoyed my stay, and will definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Decent motel, lousy location.”
Reviews.Author: HunterBarney
Reviews.Content: I must say I was disappointed in the property after reading the rave reviews here. If you're a business traveler this place is adequate but it's NOT a location for vacationers yearning for a coastal getaway. The Inn is in an industrial area with views of the freeway overpass. Old Town is at least a ten minute walk and you must cross the highway which is not pedestrian friendly. Note - don't be out and about on foot after dark as there are transients in the area. The room was clean, located in the older part of the complex. There was no micro or frig (they do offer those but none were available). Unfortunately the sound on the TV would come and go and the DVD player had 'connection issues' (the staff did come out twice and tried to fix the problems). The morning breakfast was good, the exterior of the building is lovely and overall the staff was accomodating. Price-wise it was competitive with other motels in this category. Since there's so much to do in San Diego you really don't spend alot of time in your room so I guess this place works for budget-minded travelers without kids who don't mind being across the street from a sprawling industrial complex, train depot and highway.

Reviews.Title: “Trains, Airplanes, Freeway & Street noise with uncomfotable accomodations”
Reviews.Author: unearthly
Reviews.Content: Horrible! Located on a busy street in the middle of an industrial area next to the freeway, train and plane routes. It may be close to Old Town but it is an extremely unsafe area to be in. Paper thin walls. We could hear the televisions on both sides of us as well as the occupants conversations. The concrete walkway amplified persons walking by. The sofa bed was so degraded that when you sat on it, the cushions completely flattened out and you could feel the springs and the wooden edge of the sofa. The bed had a thick lumpy plastic cover. The dÃ©cor in our room consisted of bright orange patterns. slowest wifi we have ever used did not exceed .05 at any time. The staff were nice and the breakfast was a selection of cold foods except for the waffles. We had planned to stay 6 days based on the review from trip advisor but immediately set out to find another hotel. We did manage to find another hotel that was rated lower than this one but was 100 times better for the same rates.

Reviews.Title: “Affordable, Comfortable and Homey.”
Reviews.Author: samplin
Reviews.Content: I'd checked out the Inn on a trip to San Diego in May to do planning for a family reunion in that city. These people were so kind and patient in dealing with me and the reservations for members of my family. My husband, an adult son, an infant grandson and I stayed six nights in a family suite. The other members of the family used our suite as "the hub." Their rooms were in another part of the hotel. Some went to the beach, some cruised the harbor, some went to Balboa Park and the Zoo. The location was perfect to get to all of these places. The reunion activites occupied our evenings, and again the location was perfect to get there. The suite was on the second floor in the back of the building. We heard no one from other rooms. Because it was so wonderfully cool, we slept with the windows open. Thus we did hear airplanes taking off in the morning, a problem eliminated by turning on the air-conditioning. The beds were great. A burnt out bulb in the bathroom was fixed immediately. The staff was wonderful. They allowed us to use the breakfast room for a large family gathering one evening provided we left the room clean and as we had found it which we did. We mixed up the keys several times and they were patient with us. Bottom line: we'd stay there again in a heartbeat. The moderate price made it possible to spend our funds on other activities.

Reviews.Title: “my comic con getaway”
Reviews.Author: tomatocfa
Reviews.Content: on sunday july 18th i arrived at the old town inn for the sandiego comic con the day after i checked in i met this friendley guy from canada named jules who was also attending the comic con he and i had the same intrests ,and we chatted on and off. the hotel was packed due to the comic con but the hotel staff still went out of thier way to keep the guests happy a few days later my friends tom and liza arrived and they dressed me up this year the front desk staff anna and mary thought my costumes looked neat and they both took pictures of me wearring my costumes tom and i would drive his car to the convention center in the morning and we/d take the trolley back to the hotel for breakfast thanks to the hotel staff tom liza and jules i had the best time at the comic con this year i hope and pray that the comic con dosent leave san diego so i could continue staying here

Reviews.Title: “Not bad, decent location”
Reviews.Author: Curt48187
Reviews.Content: We stayed here while touring San Diego. It was very easy to drive from here to all the sights we went to (Zoo, Balboa Park, USS Midway, Padres baseball game). San Diego is very easy to drive around, no bad traffic, you get where you are going in 10 minutes or so. You could walk to OLD Town from here but I think its better to drive. The walk would take you under a freeway and over railroad tracks, not a pretty walk. The airport is far enough away that it wasn't very loud. The breakfast was nice with a waffle station for making your own waffle. It was quiet at night for easy sleeping. The parking lot is pretty tight so it was a challenge for us to park our Chevy Suburban (rental) in the lot. The front desk staff was very courteous and helpful. I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “It is a Great Value BUT..........”
Reviews.Author: We3ski
Reviews.Content: I post frequently on Trip Advisor and consider myself a non-pretentious value traveler. I simply could not pass this place up after reading all the reviews. First trip with family to San Diego and wanted to find a gem that met our needs (close to the beach, close to town, safe and clean). The Old Town Inn was where I landed. The motel is really out of place in an industrial area a good 5-7 minute walk to Old Town and sandwiched between the rail line stop and large warehouses. The price was (with tax $150 per night for the larger two queen room. Parking is free (a definite saving compared to most motels in area). Bedding, rugs, linens and overall cleanliness was adequate. The pool was tucked away and provided a good dip between activities. Towles and plenty of chairs at least late afternoons when I used the facilities. Breakfast included in the price was comparable to Hampton Inn, Comfort Inn, etc. Enough fuel to start the day. Nothing fancy, but good. So compared to the prices I sought in Sand Diego, this was a good bargain. Now some istems to consider when thinking of booking: 1) We stayed on the weekend and the surrounding location was very empty. So anyone walking around at night appeared a bit out of place. The area is not seedy, but suspect and my work takes me daily to NYC so I have a good barometer. 2) Daytime use of the transit system is fine. Once dark, weirdos, homless, strange folks, like any other city, come out to play. Did not feel comfortable after 9:00 PM going home including the walk back to the hotel. 3) Old Town is a neat place to spend time, good food, authentic and charming. Felt comfortable there and the food was excellent. 4) The rides to the beaches (Pacific and Mission and Coronado) were all easy. THis is a great place to stop if going to Sea World, it is close by. OVERALL It is what is described but nothing more than an average place in a weird area with some nice touches. I find it hard to see it ranked so high in the San Diego area but was not upset with my decision. However, having stayed here, I would have searched further for other more coenient locations.

Reviews.Title: “Great for business or leisure.”
Reviews.Author: mike-in-bako
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a business trip and family trip within a month of each other. Both experiences were very above average. It's across the street from Old Town and trolley station which provides easy access to convention center without having to pay a the convention center price for a room. The free breakfast is decent considering they keep everything (muffins, bagels, coffee, etc.) stocked. Having a DVD player in the room with free movie loaners from the front desk was a nice and unique touch. Most of all, the price is very fair for San Diego. Sure, the hotel is a bit out of place with industries and warehouses all around it but it's not like you're moving there. I highly recommend this place and plan to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “great place”
Reviews.Author: motoxlasvegas
Reviews.Content: We were staying at another hotel and did't care for the area. We decided to check-out Old Town and discovered this hotel. The staff is very friendly and helpful. The rooms are spotless and the hotel grounds are very clean with nice tropical landscaping and a very nice heated pool. The hotel is across from the trolly that can take you just about anywhere in San Diego. Old town is a great place to spend the day. This is going to be our hotel of choice when ever we're in San Diego!

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly Simple”
Reviews.Author: mom2jazz
Reviews.Content: My 6y/o Daughter & I went to SD for a mommy & daughter trip. This motel was perfect for our budget. ROOM: Economy Queen w/ Fridge/Microwave, Shower ONLY. Iron/board, coffee maker. Room was small, room enough for the queen bed & small table. Enough room for the two of us though. Very clean. Closet was really big + dresser. Had TV & DVD player in room & you can rent DVDs at the front desk. Only thing I thought was annoying: they have automatic lights in the room & bathroom so they turn-off if you're not moving around. HOTEL & SERVICE: We got there kinda early (1pm) but room was ready for us to check-in. (NOTE: check-in is at 3pm) So we went to walk around to Old Town & got back around 2pm, not ready yet, but we were allowed to go into the pool. :) Staff was really nice. Hotel location is GREAT!!! Only a couple of blocks from Old Town SD. My daughter & I walked to it at night for dinner & was nice. It is located about 5miles to Sea World/SD Zoo...PERFECT!!!! FREE CONTINENTAL/WAFFLE BREAKFAST: it has a little eating area with tables & chairs...they had hardboiled eggs, fruit, cereal, toast, bagels, milk, juice, coffee, danishes & DIY waffles!! YUM!!! My daughter the picky-eater LOVED it!!! I really enjoyed this place. It was not pricey compared to other places near Old Town &/or Hotel Circle for a reasonable price. I'm a mom on a budget & this place was clean, safe & quaint. I'll definetly be coming back. Thank you Old Town Inn & Tripadvisor. PS Dont forget to show your AAA card when chcking in for a discount!!! :)

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for Comic Con”
Reviews.Author: ComicConMom
Reviews.Content: The rates are reasonable, especially during comic-con. It's across the street from the wonderful trolley. Best of all - the people are helpful and accommodating. They will even let you book for next year. We have stayed there since 2007.

Reviews.Title: “THE BEST HOTEL IN SAN DIEGO”
Reviews.Author: clindroth
Reviews.Content: Our family traveled for our first visit to San Diego from Wisconsin. First of all the entire staff was extremely friendly and helpful at all times. Free breakfast and free coffee in the lobby 24/7 didn't hurt either. The room was extremely clean and tastefully decorated. My wife and I asked many questions regarding public transportation as we did not have a car. We were given courteous and pleasant tips for trolley and bus lines as well as restaurants and hot spots. The main transportation hub is only a block away. Did I mention every room has a dvd player with a large selection of dvd's in the lobby, which may be checked out free of charge? The pool area is beautiful, and they lit candles on the tables for a nice touch for us night swimmers. The rate was very reasonable and I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone for a great stay in San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Good budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: alexandria77
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed 5 nights at the beginning of July. We stayed in one of the economy rooms in the back building and paid a rate of $100/night including tax. Our room was basic but was clean and comfortable which is all we needed. Our room had no bath â€“ only a shower. Not ideal but also not a problem. We were in a 2nd floor room close to the street and we did hear some traffic noise but it never kept us from sleeping and was not an issue. The pool area is lovely and we were happy we did find some time to enjoy it. Free parking was a plus. Staff were very friendly and helpful and discounts were available at the front desk for many San Diego attractions. We got a discount on the Old Town Trolley hop on/hop off tour and a discount on San Diego Zoo tickets. The description that this hotel is next to nothing but close to everything is pretty accurate. Although Old Town and the trolley station are actually very close â€“ about a 5 minute walk. Mission Beach, Balboa Park, and the Gas Lamp district are no more than a 15 minute drive. Mission Beach and Gas Lamp are probably less than that. We used our rental car to go to San Diego Zoo and it took about 15 minutes. We visited Coronado and Balboa Park on a separate day when we took the Old Town Trolley tour. We also used the Trolley to visit the Gaslamp area and the Midway museum â€“ avoided driving and parking in the downtown and harbour areas. Not sure what parking would have been like, especially given it was July 4th weekend. There was also a free continental breakfast. This was standard hotel fare â€“ very much the same as the motel we stayed at in Santa Monica. The only difference was the addition of a make your own waffle machine. Okay but not great. We ate at the hotel the first morning but ate out every morning after that. We found a great place in Old Town called Oâ€™Hungryâ€™s which served $3 hot breakfasts until 11:00 a.m. Great deal. Iâ€™ve heard some people call the Old Town area a tourist trap. However, we really loved the Old Town area and were very happy we stayed here. The area does have some touristy-type stores but there are also some great restaurants and there are several historical sites/museums to explore. The area was lively and people were friendly. Overall, we enjoyed our stay and would definitely stay again if visiting San Diego. Would not hesitate to recommend to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: Savcat
Reviews.Content: Lovely gardens and pool area, well kept. Very clean and comfortable large rooms with extra large bathroom area. Breakfast had lots of items, enough to please everyone. Nice touch was that you could borrow DVDs for free and there was a small games room. 5-10 min walk to Old Town and also the transit area, very useful for getting into various areas without driving. Would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Stay”
Reviews.Author: blinky72
Reviews.Content: ( We have been on numerous cruises on various ships, and have stayed at very nice hotels in many countries.) This is a very nice place to stay at if you are on a budget. It is our second visit in the past year. It is located next to major freeways, and streets that allow travel in any direction in order to visit sites in, or near, San Diego. The staff is friendly and helpful, the rooms are clean and well presented. The continental breakfast is fine. I would recommend this facility. I rate it a 7 out of 15 For pictures, use Google Maps, select the address and street view feature.

Reviews.Title: “Most Uncomfortable Beds I Have Ever Slept On”
Reviews.Author: MtnBrd
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Old Town Inn for two nights in July 2010. It is in an unusual location, wedged between an industrial area and the highway. The Old Town is a 5-10 minute walk away (across the highway and rail line) and features a number of Mexican restaurants and Mexican inspired tourist shops. The hotel is located midway between the downtown area and the beaches, so is somewhat convenient in that sense (and assuming you have a car). There are a number of different kinds of rooms. Our room featured a king size bed, mini fridge and microwave. The traffic noise was not an issue if you kept your window shut. The shower was a bit unusual, as the shower head was located at shoulder height. Only minimal toiletries were provided by the hotel. The room smelled heavily of cleaning products. There was free WiFi and one computer to use in the lobby (which was always busy). The bed was extremely soft and was arguably the most uncomfortable bed I have ever had in a hotel.
