Left me with a very sore back. I was glad to check out and get a good night's sleep elsewhere. The bed was so uncomfortable that I would not recommend this hotel to anyone. Breakfast was included. It was nice to be able to make our own waffles in the morning. There was also fruit, cereal and pastries. The hotel staff were friendly but not particularly knowledgeable and had difficulty recommending a restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel.”
Reviews.Author: adamfilip
Reviews.Content: me and my family, (myself, wife, 3yr son, 18month daughter) spent 5 nights at the old town inn. it was a nice little hotel. rooms were clean. Internet was free (but slow and hard to connect sometimes) parking was free (nice) the complimentary breakfast was great. waffled, danishes, OJ, muffins, cereal. bagels, coffee, tea, hot choc, fruit etc.. hotel staff was very helpful. we asked for a crib for our daughter and it was old looking for safe and perfect for our needs. occasionally we heard a Train horn at 10pm. didnt get to try the pool out. area looks a little shady.. i wish it was in a better part of town.. but its ok.. hotel sits on a one way street so sometimes gettign somewhere or back to the hotel can be a small pain depending where you are going or coming from. I would go back.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice”
Reviews.Author: pk2211
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located in an industrial area just a short walk from Old Town. The staff was friendly and eager to help make out stay enjoyable.Our room was very clean and modern and our son enjoyed the ultra clean pool and the small game room. The grounds were nicely landscaped and the property was quiet considering the proximity of major highways. We had a very nice stay and were a short drive to many attractions. A decent continental breakfast was included for the low rate of $89 per night. I would not hesitate to stay at this hotel again or recommend it to a friend. Thanks to the staff at the Old Town Inn for making our stay memorable.

Reviews.Title: “beautiful,clean,large rooms”
Reviews.Author: katalina66
Reviews.Content: We recently found ourselves without a hotel reservation in san diego and found a coupon book,since it was a saturday,not a deal by any means and a little up PCH then we usually are,we were pleasantly surprised to find a nice clean,large room,great breakfast including eggs!yay! and free movies to check out in lobby,pleasant staff and pretty close to most everything,would definetely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “This place was awesome! We found this on...”
Reviews.Author: zombielova
Reviews.Content: This place was awesome! We found this on tripadvisor & I'm glad we did. The check-in was awesome (dont knw his name, sorry) & very helpful. We had a cute little cottage room that was clean & cozy, had a dvd player (movies & board games available for check out in the lobby), the pool was awesome & continental breakfast good. The location may seem desolete but within walking distance is Old Town San Diego. The motel recommended great pizza & mexican food places, & gives awesome driving directions to beaches & other attractions. Rebekah at the front desk was very helpful & polite, & the pool even has a barbeque for guest use. It's very family friendly as well. I'd totally recommend this hotel for any type of visitor. Thanks for making the end of our trip awesome!

Reviews.Title: “Great choice for Old Town”
Reviews.Author: shar4813
Reviews.Content: We wanted to stay near Old Town and have good transportation. This had it all. We were very pleasantly surprised with what we found. It was clean, the staff was wonderful and it was quiet. Everything was done with the upmost care. I would definitly stay there again if in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeds Expectations”
Reviews.Author: LandCruisers
Reviews.Content: We stayed here three times within a five week period, including one 8-day stay (actually, we are still here as I write this), wondering when the bubble would burst. It never did. Throughout our stays the staff were helpful, responsive, and cheerful. The breakfasts exceeded expectations, with not only fresh fruit, cereal, pastries, and bagels, but a waffle machine--we've never seen that before! We stayed in the less expensive smaller "older" rooms as well as the newer larger rooms, and thought both were a good value. The smaller rooms are simply smaller copies of the bigger ones: two double beds instead of two queen beds, not as much sink area in the bathroom, no tub, and overall not as much space to spread out. If all you really want is a nice place to sleep, the smaller rooms are fine. The WIFI was fast and reliable. There are reading lights and three trashcans, things we always appreciate, but don't always find. The daily newspapers in the lobby and the availability of some great movies to check out for free are additional bonuses. Nice place!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Choice for San Diego”
Reviews.Author: GammaJean
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Old Town Inn while in San Diego to visit our grandson and were very pleased. We stayed there due to the good recommendations given it on this site and it was one of the best motels we had during our whole trip. It is very clean and well kept, and we weren't bothered at all by noise from the freeway. It's being so close to Old Town and the trolley were a bonus and made it easy to get to those places. We would definitely stay there again if we are ever back in San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience, great stay”
Reviews.Author: robbieinindia
Reviews.Content: My wife and I visited the Old Town Inn while traveling with our 5 month old daughter, our two friends and their 6 month old son. Superb experience: friendly, accommodating staff, comfortable, clean rooms with lots of genuinely helpful instructions and information, delicious breakfast (including make-your-own waffle machines). Added extras like a free to use DVD library (with some surprisingly good titles - not just Disney and 10-year old 'classics' make you feel like they actually care about taking care of their guests, and making their stay enjoyable. Short walk from the old-town, and you can drive wherever else you want to go. Honestly, I wasn't expecting a lot when we booked here, but we were blown away by how uncommonly nice it was to stay here. P.S. Even the candies at reception were excellent - Lime Rickeys??

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon Traveler...Much pleased”
Reviews.Author: dpvoice
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for the last leg of our honeymoon. We started off in Europe and were planning to fly back to San Diego to continue our honeymoon when the volcano ash hit which delayed our flight. On top of that a plane piece malfunction delayed us another day. In fact, our return date was in flux due to so much uncertainty. We scrambled like crazy to move our hotel stay at Old Town Inn from Europe. We changed the date several times and I even had my mom call several times because we had trouble connecting from where we were. Anna was unbelievable in providing us superb customer service. She was so patient and kind. When we finally got back to the States I found out everything was in order. My mom told me that no matter how many times she had to move the date due to the flight mishap Anna was kind and courteous throughout. When we finally arrived both my wife and I got to meet Anna personally and Anna was just as kind and accommodating in person as she was on the phone. Very patient and very professional throughout. Thanks, Anna! Also, the room was clean and the facilities were nice and we were close the airport which was great. No complaints whatsoever! We will likely return as we had a great experience.

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: Hopenjoy
Reviews.Content: I'm a local so I'm familiar with the location and needed a place to stay with my cat while my house was being 'termited.' Anna was wonderful in getting me checked in and the staff was supportive in leaving my room alone so that the cat wasn't disturbed. I found the room to be very clean and while not the quietest due to it's proximity to the train/trolley lines, it was not a hindrance to sleeping. The location might be frightening at first to some out of towners, but I assure you it is very safe and easily accessible to the majority of San Diego's attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Impressed with the friendliness of front desk from initial phone contact on”
Reviews.Author: joyceinpa
Reviews.Content: Anna and Mary were helpful with suggestions re restaurants and directions. I lost an earring in my room. I left a note and Laura found at her next cleaning. A special thank you to the above! The breakfast was very nice. There was no traffic noise. The only complaint is the sewer odor in the room a slight but noticable particularly when first entering.

Reviews.Title: “Not at all what I expected! Don't waste your money here.”
Reviews.Author: Enjoy_LIfe_N_Travel
Reviews.Content: Finnaly getting around to writing my review. I stayed here because of all the glowing reviews. The Old Town Inn was not at all up to my expectations. The analog to digital conversion took place weeks prior to my stay, but this hotel still had not made any provisions for this. No converter box or cable service. Basically, no channels at all. The television was totally useless. When making a reservation, there were no doubles available. Upon arrival, I asked and was told there was one available, but instead of giving me the rate quoted for this room at the time of booking, I was charged $50 extra per night!!! The lobby was locked upon check-out. Staff was nowhere to be found. Renovations taking place while I was there. Very noisy day and night. Very thin walls! Very dirty, seedy location and not good if it's the Gas light district you want to see. You can do better with just about any other hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Our new hideaway for celebrating anniversaries.”
Reviews.Author: Linny1960
Reviews.Content: Wanted to find nice place near Old Town to celebrate anniversary. Found by accident on the internet. Chose because they had a room with huge bathtub- jacuzzi. Room was in older section of hotel, we were told newer rooms bigger more modern, (but we didn't get a chance to check them out). Even though our room was considered older section of hotel, our room was perfect. Had the feel of a small cottage, but had plenty of room even with jacuzzi and big walk in shower with large glass door. Perfect for celebrating 30th anniversary, very intimate, romantic, and quiet. Rooms and grounds were well kept and everyone on staff was overly helpful and friendly. Was only about block away from Old Town and trolley/ coaster station, and 5 minute straight down the road drive to harbor and downtown. We will be back and we both prefer the older cottage style rooms. Next year we plan on bring some deck chairs to sit out in front of room during evening. Plan on staying longer from now on. Have already recommended to our friends.

Reviews.Title: “Exactly what we wanted!!!”
Reviews.Author: MusicMajor
Reviews.Content: After reading most of the reviews for Old Town Inn on Tripadvisor, we booked a 3 night stay for the beginning of May. Everything about our experience was excellent. Many of the other reviews comment on the excellent staff, the great location, the large rooms, and the cleanliness so I have no need to repeat their comments. I would like to add several of my own however. First, in reading the reviews I noticed several that were negative. Those reviews were quite old and all of the problems mentioned seem to have been addressed. Second, what makes the Old Town Inn so special is all of the "little things".......coffee and tea available in the lobby all the time......an extra-large sink area in the bathroom.....computer availability.....and so much more. Third, at the time of booking I asked for a "quiet room" and we were given a room on the 3rd floor. No car doors slamming. No noise from above. And last, the "tunnel" to get to Old Town that was mentioned in quite a few of the reviews was a bit off-putting to me until I saw it. It is large, bright, artistically decorated, and under 24/7 security monitoring. I worried for nothing! We are not "Ritz Carleton" clientelle, but we do appreciate a large, well-appointed, clean room, a nice breakfast, and helpful staff. The Old Town Inn is all of that - and more!

Reviews.Title: “A San Diego GEM!”
Reviews.Author: megew
Reviews.Content: I made a reservation at Old Town Inn for my husband and me to stay at after I picked him up from the airport from a deployment oversees. Everything about this hotel was above and beyond what I expected, even before we got there! Anna was so wonderful in helping and allowed me to check in early so that I could get our stuff in there and do some decorating before I picked my husband up at the airport in the morning. The lobby was beautiful and very homey and welcoming The room (we had the jacuzzi sweet) was spotless, large, and beautifully maintained. After sleeping in the same sleeping bag for six months, I don't think my husband could have had a more comfortable bed to sleep in his first night back in the US! I am so thankful for how kind the staff was and how well kept the room was. We are already planning our next weekend getaway to San Diego and we will be staying at Old Town Inn!

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Place To Stay”
Reviews.Author: mommyof2princesses
Reviews.Content: We were a little worried when we drove up as the hotel appears to be in an industrial area, but once you pull in it is like a little oasis. There are beautiful flowers around the pool, it is just a short walk to Old Town which was little interesting, the room was a good size and very comfortable. We bought our zoo tickets at the front desk at a discounted price. The free breakfast was good, not as extensive as some of the other places but enough to keep us going. If you get hungry later there is a grea pizza place within walking distance called Pizza Bella in Old Town.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, reasonably priced.”
Reviews.Author: pat-hopper
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at this lovely Old Town Inn March 2010, this being the start of our three week vacation. The location was perfect, easy access to the trolley and buses for down town San Diego so a car was not really needed. Staff were friendly and more than helpful especially Anna the office Manager who was a credit to the company l. We would definately use this charming place again and would highly recommend this to all.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay”
Reviews.Author: Cheri416
Reviews.Content: After a very grueling drive, we arrived late in the evening and was very surprised. The surrounding area looked a little industrial. From the moment we checked in we were met with a very pleasant young man at the front desk. So very happy that even though we were on second floor, there was an elevator. The room very very clean. No smell of cigarettes. There was no noise. The next morning the morning employees, were very pleasant. The cleaning ladies helped me to the elevator with my luggage. The breakfast was just what we all needed. The other guests seemed just as pleased as we were. We had 14 family and friends all staying there for my nephews graduation from Marine Boot Camp.. I would recommend this Inn to all who are traveling with or without children.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money and well located for a family stay in SD”
Reviews.Author: PerroGrande
Reviews.Content: My family (2 adults and 3 young kids) has just completed a month's travel through California & Las Vegas and stayed 4 nights at the Old Town Inn, San Diego. We stayed in a 1 bedroom Family Room consisting of 2 queen beds + sofa bed, kitchen and (small) dining table, lounge room, etc. Positives: First impressions were a little deceiving. This hotel isnâ€™t much to look at â€“ it is situated in what appears to be an industrial area that, at first glance, seems to be in the middle of nowhere. However, the location turned out to be a good one in that it is just 10 minutes walk to major shops and restaurants, 5 minutes walk to Old Town Historic Park(including the hop-on hop-off orange trolley car terminal), a 3 minute walk to San Diegoâ€™s major public transport hub from where buses and trains depart regularly (meaning easy access to the Zoo, Seaworld, downtown, etc). The room was quite spacious and clean, and the beds were comfortable enough. Car parking is free. Staff were very friendly and always keen to assist. Maps were available, as was a 1 pager providing tips on public transport, locations of nearby grocery stores/pharmacies/etc, and other useful information. But it was the little extras that made this hotel one that I would gladly stay at again. The continental breakfast lacked nothing â€“ we couldnâ€™t have asked for more in terms of variety and quality. The hotel provided free DVDs and board games for guests (a great bonus when youâ€™ve got young children). There was free computer and internet access in the lobby area, which also provided free coffee throughout the evening, as well as a sofa (with fire-place), newspapers and books to read. On request, a full box of kitchen utensils and equipment was delivered to our room, meaning that we could cook dinner rather than having to dine out every night Negatives: The family rooms are located in the rear corners of the main building, and lacked any natural light, even in the middle of the day. Furniture was a little outdated, and at times the room had a bit of a musty smell to it. Summary: The Old Town Inn is not a luxury hotel â€“ in fact its rooms are quite basic. But it is neat and clean, and its family suite was clean, spaciious and contained everything our family needed. I would happily stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “EXCEEDED EXPECTATIONS”
Reviews.Author: mungi
Reviews.Content: Great staff that are genuinely interested in helping guests. Walking distance to Old Town and trolley to Gaslamp district. Very nice clean hotel and the rooms are very large. Good breakfast included. Although it is located on a fairly busy road we did not hear any noise. We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Old Town Inn puts the customer first”
Reviews.Author: mnwoods4
Reviews.Content: If you travel as much as we do, you too will find Old Town Inn at 4444 Pacific Highway (I give the address so as not to confuse it with any other Old Town hotel) the respectable, quality hotel that has the rare "customer first" attitude many other hotels these days do not. We stayed here last year (March 2009) and booked to stay again this year (March 2010) and the quality and service has not changed. If anything, the hotel has improved. We had an unusual traveling situation (we were flying standby from overseas) and so were not able to pinpoint a definite time for arrival/departure. Not only did Beatriz and other hotel staff members help us with rental car and taxi information, they also held our room and did not blink an eye to many last minute changes we had to make due to our standby status at the airport changing frequently. We never got an endless ring or a busy tone, a re-routing of our call to a main office somewhere out of state while making/changing reservations, and we were never put into "hold heaven" each phone call we made. Our calls were answered within a few rings, the staff (especially Beatriz) was courteous and understanding with our changes, and professional. They EVEN called us back to let us know our room was ready EARLY, along with suggestions of a quieter room they had off the highway side!! Wow. It is a bit older facility, but certainly not in its pride in ownership and management. The grounds are impeccable, the pool surrounded with pretty bushes and flowers, and the rooms clean, comfortable and spacious. Though not in "hot spot" locations other popular, familiar-named hotels tout, Old Town Inn is MORE conveniently located, in our opinion. It is an oasis in an otherwise not so "bling bling," stuffy city location. When freeways and highways in downtown, airport, and Gaslamp Quarter areas get congested with traffic (often) you will wish you never parked a car (and paid a daily fee for doing so!) at a hotel other than one positioned like where the Old Town Inn is. Its Pacific Highway location is this hotel's best kept secret, especially when pressed for time to get to and from the airport and car rental pick up/drop off locations in a hurry. It also is a short walk from the lobby of the hotel to the bus/shuttle/trolley station in Old Town. The rates are remarkably affordable for such a great location. Though along the road, past the bus station, and then down under a highway tunnel, we felt safe (even at night) in walking, as a family, from our room to Old Town (great restaurants, stores, and nice town to enjoy and walk through!) We give 5 stars in all areas to this respectable, family-oriented, professionally run, and "customer first" attitude hotel. We WILL go back!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: 4hisglory0522
Reviews.Content: I love, love this hotel. I was a little reluctant because it wasn't a hotel chain but boy was I in for a treat. I accidentally booked a smoking room and I asked the lady behind the counter if there was any way I could get a non-smoking room. She ended up giving me an upgrade free of charge because it was the only non-smoking room available. She also decided to make my room an upstairs room due to the fact I was a solo female(safety reasons). I didn't even think of that. I asked where I could get a decent mexican meal and she gladly reccommended a place that was more than decent. She even gave me a map of old town and marked the directions out for me. The customer service was first class. The location was also excellent. It was five minutes from EVERYTHING!!!! My only gripe and it really wasn't that big of a deal compared to everything else is the bed wasn't very comfortable and the pillows were not very solid. I will definitely be back!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Awesome Price”
Reviews.Author: marquino7050
Reviews.Content: Stayed a couple of nights to go to seaworld. The staff was very helpful with tickets, directions, everything. The breakfast was basic but good. The drive to Seaworld was quick and easy, plus we also got to drive around the california coast. Great place to stay for such a good price. Will definitely come again.

Reviews.Title: “Nicest Front Desk Staff Ever!”
Reviews.Author: mh999
Reviews.Content: What caught my eye was that this Inn was rated #5 by travelers to San Diego, and most of the reviews were very good. I'm SO happy to have gone with both the research and my intuition when I booked this hotel for a weekend getaway with my college-age daughter to kick off her spring break and to visit friends. Even before the trip, the man who took my reservation by phone offered a "student" discount when I told him the reason for the trip. I was amazed at the low price I was offered, after what I'd read about the hotel. Then, when we checked in, Mary at the front desk was both friendly and very professional. She made me feel both welcome and safe! The room was immaculately clean (I even saw a man who was cleaning the restroom by the pool who was gloved and masked and doing such a good job he didn't even see me watching him---ok, ok, I'm a person concerned about cleanliness). The beds were very comfortable and we slept well...this is a really nice place to stay and it is convenient to EVERYTHING in San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely Clean, great comfortable beds, helpful staff. Would stay again!”
Reviews.Author: mdavis390
Reviews.Content: After reading reviews on Trip Advisor, we chose this property for our final night in San Diego. We had stayed up in Carlsbad for several nights before and enjoyed the stay at another family oriented property at a much higher rate. We were happy to discover that the Old Town Inn lived up to its reputation on Trip Advisor. The beds are extremely comfortable and the rooms are very clean. Thae staff was very helpful. My only comment for improvement would be to add some protein to the breakfast offering. Eggs (even hard boiled) and microwave bacon/sausage maybe.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: Ciel_M
Reviews.Content: The location is a little off the beaten path from all the other hotels in the area - this one is in an industrial neighborhood, which is I *think* why the price is so darned good. That being said, it is literally a very short walk to the SD trolley station or Old Town, so you really cannot beat the location. Throw in FREE parking and FREE internet, and you really cannot find a better value in this area! The staff is very friendly and accommodating - we e-mailed ahead of time to request early check in and our room was ready the minute we arrived. There is a movie library of DVD's you can check out for free and a very nice pool as well. The hotel is very close to the freeway (as are ALL hotels in this area) and the trolley station, however, I am a very light sleeper, and I didn't have to use ear plugs to get a good night's sleep. However, the bed was much too soft for myself and my husband, and our backs were a bit achy in the morning. I appreciated the conservation efforts made by this hotel by installing auto-off motion-sensor lights in their rooms, but I also felt the lighting was a little dim for applying makeup. I also appreciated the *very* spacious vanity area outside the toilet area and I liked that there was a sink in both the toilet room and the vanity room; this made it easy for the 3 of us to get ready in a snap.

Reviews.Title: “Cute place, good location, great service”
Reviews.Author: turbo_dog
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 3 nights in early February 2010. I was very pleased for the price paid (less than half of what I've paid on Hotel circle). The staff was excellent...all interested and interesting to talk to. I had a sweet little room. Free parking. Good breakfast buffet. Free computer with high speed in the lobby, heated pool, plus free DVD library. It is within 3 blocks of Old Town. I felt a little nervous walking back at 10pm as a lone woman, but I'd feel that way in any city. Next time, I'd drive and park closer to Old Town shops if I was coming back late at night. I will definitely stay here in San Diego again for the value and service. I also like supporting a local business. I stayed in an economy room and it was fine. A little small, but so was the price.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location... Great Room!”
Reviews.Author: wesu
Reviews.Content: We came to San Diego to visit some Family but, to also have our own little romantic getaway.. This was a Fantastic place to stay! The service was great.. All the desk clerks were well trained, familiar with the area and very efficient.. The House keepers were also very friendly and did a Wonderful job! This was a very clean and Family friendly hotel! I could not be more pleased with the choice we made! My Girfriend and I stayed in the Jacuzzi suite!! And believe me I got brownie points for that 1! he room was big, the bed was more comfy than ours at home.. And the fireplace was a awesome touch! All in all this was a great trip! Next time we are in San Diego we will be staying at The Old Town Inn!

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: james2anne
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel is initially offputting - right next to the 6-lane Pacific Coast Highway, near a railway line and near the airport, so there is plenty of noise from cars, trains and planes. However, we got a room (number 144) as far as possible from the Highway, and it was pretty quiet. In other respects, the location of the hotel is excellent, a short walk to Old Town and the Transit Centre with trolley and bus connections. Its a short drive to Sea World, Downtown and Balboa Park (where we spent 3 days visiting museums). The hotel grounds and pool are well cared for, the staff are friendly and attentive and the free breakfast is quite good. We had a Queen Economy room, nicely furnished though a bit cramped, with wireless internet. The price of $89/night including taxes was excellent value, since you could easily pay a lot more in San Diego. We would recommend the Old Town Mexican Cafe at 2489 San Diego Avenue.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay, Great Staff, Close to Everything”
Reviews.Author: guitarbobsd
Reviews.Content: My family needed to stay at a hotel while the floors were being redone at our home. We were looking for; value, location, dog friendly, all mixed with genuine hospitality. We could not of been more pleased with our stay at The Old Town Inn. The staff is very well trained in providing each traveler with hospitality specific to one's individual needs. The lobby is very inviting with a fire going on cooler winter days and nights. As a resident of San Diego I am aware of how well situated this Inn is to downtown, nightlife, airport, and tourist attractions. Very nice restaurants are within walking distance in Old Town. With rooms at different price points, and all of them well appointed and clean, this Inn deserves serious consideration for the traveler.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent place! Exceptional service.”
Reviews.Author: Oddmund
Reviews.Content: Had the attendant ask me if I wanted the radio turned down as I was reading. Great location close to trains, planes, rental cars, shopping and tourism/coast.

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENT STAY and CLOSE TO EVERYTHING DOWNTOWN”
Reviews.Author: angel37PhoenixAz
Reviews.Content: I have to say the room was super clean and comfortable. They had DVD's to take back to your room if you wanted to check one out from the many offered in the office. The breakfast that is served by the hotel is awsome! not just your average donuts and coffee they have everything even a make your own waffle station! A cute pool and area to kick back with your friends and family and even a gas BBQ grill in the pool area for the guest to use. They also had a laundry for the guest to wash if needed, ( dont go home with diry clothes!) i was so impressed with this cute little gem of a hotel. Not to mention it has a nice convience store very close by to purchase your drinking needs ( of the Adult kind.) And here is the best part they are a Gay Friendly hotel for all you family out there.

Reviews.Title: “Love the Old Town Inn, we stay there nearly every visit”
Reviews.Author: EzzyWisconsin
Reviews.Content: We fly in and out of San Diego at least annually to visit family several miles northeast of there. We've tried several hotels in and around San Diego to stay theday before our return flight so we don't have to try to drive a few hours on the day of our flight home. We like the Old Town Inn best of those we've tried. It's convenient to everything, clean, homey and friendly staff make it ideal for our needs. Staying there is a nice end to our trip and leaves us relaxed rather than anxious for the flight home.

Reviews.Title: “I love this hotel”
Reviews.Author: tomatocfa
Reviews.Content: this year i decided to spend new years eve in san diego's gaslamp district i had a four day weekend so i spent it at this hotel .when i arrived iwas greeted by my good friend anna. i got there right before her shift ended and she checked my into my room pronto. i had plenty of time to rest up before partying. i went to this really cool place called jimmy loves.the they had a lavish dinner buffet and a live rock band .i dancned until the clock struck midnight.then i had to fight my way through the crowded people in the streets to catch the trolley im lucky this hotel is right across the street from the trolley station. the next night i went back to the gaslamp district and another favorite staff person of mine mary suggested this cowboy bar they just opened called the double duce.and there was a guy on the corner dressed like a cowboy handing out complimentry tickets to the place so i went there and they had this really neat mechanical bull that you could ride on. overall this was an awsome for day weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent; would definitely stay here again.”
Reviews.Author: batbrewer
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on a business trip for 4 nights in December 2009. I was using public transport and chose the hotel for its location near to Old Town Transit Center, which is a few minutes walk away. Although the hotel is on the Pacific Highway and close to the San Diego Freeway, there isn't much road noise, just the occasional distant hoot from Amtrak trains passing through Old Town station. The room was spacious and clean, with a clean, good-sized bed, and everything worked. The TV was of good quality; I didn't use the free DVD library, but thought it was a nice touch anyhow. Staff were friendly, very helpful (I needed some toiletries which were provided free of charge on request at the front desk), polite and efficient. The self-service breakfast was all you need, and the room rate was pretty reasonable. In summary, I would definitely stay here again --- even if I had my own transport and didn't have to be near to public transport like I did this time.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Value in San Diego”
Reviews.Author: PreciousKitty2010
Reviews.Content: We have been visiting the Old Town Inn for the last 5 years and it is the only hotel that we will stay in when we travel to San Diego. The grounds are neat and clean and the rooms are great. You will not find a better value for your money in San Diego. We enjoy the swimming pool and the all you can eat breakfast room. I guarantee that you will not be disappointed with your stay.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid if you need a reliable internet connection.”
Reviews.Author: Laflore
Reviews.Content: Location was ok - a bit noisy, though, next to the Pacific Highway in a business district. I was also unhappy with the amount of noise coming through the walls and ceiling from adjacent rooms. My biggest disappointment was the very poor internet performance. Very long webpage loading times and frequent disconnects makes it hard to get work done. Why did they cut corners here? Worst internet performance of any hotel I've been to recently.

Reviews.Title: “Best place to stay in San Diego”
Reviews.Author: divertravelerSalem
Reviews.Content: Great location and service. I will return with my family next time we are in SD.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Spudrunner
Reviews.Content: If you want something better than a typical motel but don't want to pay the prices for 5 star high rise hotel accommodations, then Old Town Inn (OTI) is the best choice. In my experience, I would compare OTI with a really good Holiday Inn Express. The rooms are very clean, roomy and modern. The showers are great with lots of hot water. The breakfasts are excellent and the coffee is particularly good. The king size bed was very comfortable and we slept very well. The staff is very attentive, friendly and helpful. OTI is centrally located and freeway access is not far away. Old Town is just down the street which is well worth a visit. They have a library of movies on DVD that you can play in your room. About the only downside is that there is some road noise and some airport noise but that is basically true of all hotels in downtown San Diego. OTI is a great hotel at a great price.

Reviews.Title: “Old Town Inn is awesome.”
Reviews.Author: scvacationer1
Reviews.Content: Truely a hidden gem. Stayed for three nights, was able to check in early 9 am, and enjoyed heated pool, continental breakfast, very dog friendly. Anna at the front desk was very helpful with accomodations, directions to attractions and dinning. Housekeeping worked well with schedule, cleaning room when we left with dog. 5 minutes to Seaworld, 10 minutes to Zoo. Great location. Large king bed room with couch. Lots of free movies to watch. Pool was warm. Fresh coffee, lemon water, and tea always available. Thanks Anna for our great San Diego vacation. Great rates.

Reviews.Title: “Top notch location and wonderful employees!!”
Reviews.Author: MissLuLew
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Old Town Inn with my husband, nephew (who was visiting us from FL), and 2 small dogs for 2 nights, beginning Friday, 11-27-09. The Inn's employees, especially Mary, were top notch--very friendly, helpful, and professional. There's fresh, hot coffee available in the lobby at all times, a heated pool, beautiful flowering vegetation, and a great complimentary breakfast. Our room was clean, spacious, and comfortable. Although we drove from Tempe, AZ, the hotel was very convenient to the San Diego airport and not directly under the jets' flight paths, so the noise wasn't distracting. The hotel is within walking distance to Old Town with its great shops, museums, and restaurants, and also to public transportation, which made visiting the Gas Lamp District a pleasure as we did not have to worry about driving while under the influence or taking pricey cabs. The Old Town Trolley Tour began and ended in Old Town--definitely a must-do if it's your first visit to the area. Access to Sea World and La Jolla was a breeze, as the freeway entrance was about 2 blocks away. The San Diego Harbor was an easy drive for those going fishing or seeking a good seafood restaurant. For those wanting to see the majesty of the Pacific Ocean and the California coast, Sunset Cliffs was a short drive from the Inn as well. We will definitely stay at the Old Town Inn on our next visit to the San Diego area.

Reviews.Title: “Like staying with family!”
Reviews.Author: FieroLangleyBC
Reviews.Content: The value of this location is excellent. The facilities are well kept. The breakfast is very nice. There are many nice touches offered, such as the lovely urn of cold water in the lobby, the free internet, or the complimentary coffee in the lobby. The most noticeable difference is the friendly staff and their pleasant demeanor and relationships. It's like staying with good friends or family!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: DoraemonCute
Reviews.Content: Convenience -10 minutes walking distance to Old Town City which you can get a lot of nice food. -5 minutes walking distance to Old Town Metro Transit system and bus stop Safety -No any hotel or restaurant near by, only factory and company. It seems quiet, and no much car around 5.30pm(winter time). It a bit scary but check with hotel staffs, it safe area. -No gate between hotel room and outside walking path. This is mean that anyone who pass by this hotel can direct to hotel room without passing through lobby. Hotel Facilities -Nice swimming pool -Economy room quite small, but clean, new and pretty -Lobby is very pretty -Breakfast is the best breakfast I ever eat since I stayed in USA rate 2-3* hotels -Breakfast area is nice, spacious and clean -You can use breakfast area to connect wire internet and having your pack-in dinner. -Hotel staffs are friendly and helpful. -Housekeeping are great enough

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: bzymom22
Reviews.Content: My husband was on a 2 week business trip in Yuma, AZ so we decided to meet up in San Diego for the weekend. My husband drove in from Yuma and I flew in from Minneapolis. I booked this hotel based on the reviews here at Trip Advisor. My DH got to the room first and sent me a text "Good choice." We stayed in a room with one queen bed. It was a smaller room, but had a small walk in closet for storing luggage. There was a iron with board in the closet. The bathroom is no smaller than a normal hotel room and had only a shower. There was a hair dryer in the bathroom. The TV does not get very many channels, but they have free DVD rentals. None these things bother DH & I as we planned to spend very little time in the room. The room was extremely clean and the bed was comfortable. There is a free breakfast that has a lot of the basic breakfast foods including a waffle maker, bagels/pastries, cereal, fruit, coffee, orange juice, etc. We did not go in the pool, but felt the water. It was heated to a nice temperature. The grounds are well maintained. There was free WI-FI in the room. The staff was very friendly and helpful. They gave us some good recommendations for dinner within walking distance of the hotel. The hotel is located quick walk from Old Town and a block away from the public transit center. There are some industrial/warehouse type buildings next door. We stayed there on the weekend so it was quiet. Don't know if it would be more noise during a week day. The hotel is also located by a freeway so it is convenient to anywhere you want to go. We could get most places in 15 minutes. It was $15-16 dollar cab fare to/from the airport. I think this hotel is an excellent value for the money.

Reviews.Title: “This hidden gem is well worth it!!”
Reviews.Author: blueeyes32
Reviews.Content: Wife and I decided to take a trip to San Diego! After reading a few reviews on Trip Adviser we decided to make a mini get a way to the Old Town Inn. As soon as we drove in the hotel we knew this was going to be a great weekend. The landscaping is so nice and the property looked very clean. We has no reservations but Anna helped us get in a nice room with a king bed. She also helped us plan a dinner in Old Town! The hotel offers a free breakfast, free wifi, free movie rentals, you can't get anywhere else! there is are lots of movies to choose from. The restaurant are a few blocks from the hotel(walking distance). The rooms are clean and the beds are very comfortable. The staff is so nice and helpful. We do plan on taking another mini vacation and you can bet we are coming back. Ask for Anna, she will help you with just about anything.

Reviews.Title: “home away from home”
Reviews.Author: sfraysur
Reviews.Content: WOW!ROOMS-----AMAZING! BEDS: COULDNT GET OUT OF IT!!!! BETTER THAN MY BED AT HOME...STAFF MADE ME FEEL LIKE FAMILY! The staff was so helpful and amazing! Everyone was always smiling! I was helped by the beautiful Ms Mary and Handsome Mr Scott... I have small kids and they let us borrow every movie in their library....one at a time of course ;) One of the cutest touches was the water w/ lemon in the lobby. My kids loved staying there we used the pool which was heated and we swam at night...it is close to EVERYTHING but very quite, even though its right by the highways. this is my 3rd stay at the hotel and they never cease to amazing me! I'd stay here everynight if i could. I love spending my vacation with them! And, when you stay here you have to cross the street to eat at pizza bella best pizza EVER!!

Reviews.Title: “good staff”
Reviews.Author: CaliforniaPat
Reviews.Content: the motel experience for in the past has been a nightmare but my stay at the old town inn was great the staff were very polite and helpful. movies rentals were free and the travel was easy everything was easy to get directions to

Reviews.Title: “mi segundo casa”
Reviews.Author: tomatocfa
Reviews.Content: on july 19th i spent the entire week at this hotel for the san diego comic con. i been coming here since 2001.and the staff is like mi familia to me they 'make sure i get an affordable discount on my hotel bill and i became close to the managers beatriz and anna.i enjoy 'gracing them with my presence.the staff works very 'hard at pleasing the cusstomers.this hotel always gets sold out during the san diego comic con but the staff manages to be helpful without pressure. this year i made new friends at the comic con and ariana helped me book them a room for next years comic con., to the staff at the old town inn con aofadec imiento por su gran hospitalidad que nos brindaste a mi and mi amigo como siempre nos facino su buen servicio . muchos gracias por todo

Reviews.Title: “Would stay here again”
Reviews.Author: BCBBY
Reviews.Content: There were 4 of us in our party staying at the Old Town Inn. It is really clean and comfortable and breakfast was really good, coffee, juices, bagels etc. were always fresh and topped up. It is really close to the Old Town area where the shuttles to downtown areas are available as well as taxis. Check-in staff (Anna) was really friendly and helpful. Anna even took the time to try to help us check-in online as we were having difficulty in doing so, but it was a technical problem with the reservation system. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice quiet place in a good location”
Reviews.Author: nworock
Reviews.Content: Seemed to get good reviews here so we checked it out. Overall we were pleased with it. Decently priced, it's right off the interstates and is just minutes away from shopping and all the big San Diego attractions. Old Town district is a quick walk away. It's a little off path as it's in an industrial area, but it's easily accessible everywhere and nice and quiet at night. Pool was nice, but we really loved the free breakfast with make your own waffles! Room was decent. We got the cheapest one which was just one queen size bed, only thing that was a bit of a surprise was no bathtub, just a stand up shower. No big deal for us since we were only there for a couple nights, but if you're planning on staying for a bit and want a full bath you might want to look into that. Staff was very friendly and helpful with tours and such. Oh, another neat feature was free DVD rentals. All rooms had a DVD player and the movies themselves were plentiful and free. Neat little feature. Overall we've stayed at places with nicer and bigger rooms for the price maybe, but the location and little features more than made up for that. If we go to San Diego again I can certainly see us staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT PLACE ALL AROUND”
Reviews.Author: Merkat09
Reviews.Content: Great value, location, staff, updated rooms & really really clean! Motel within walking distance to Old Town, 10 minutes to Airport & car rental pick up & returns, 20 minutes to Coronado & other beaches. Close to zoo, sea world & many other sites as well as highways 5 , 8 & 15. What more can I say. This was the best room I have had in a long, long time and I had just come in from a spa resort in the Palm Springs area that could not compare with the Old Town Inn or it's staff. You also got free breakfast here. When I go back to San Diego Old Town Inn will be my place of choice! It is on Pacific Hwy but that did not bother me or my spouse and we did not hear any hwy noise at all when we turned in for the night. Do give it a try!

Reviews.Title: “Diamond in the rough”
Reviews.Author: luckyamerica36
Reviews.Content: This was our second trip to the Inn and once again we were very pleased with our stay.We had 2 rooms next door to each other on the top floor which i requested on our booking.The rooms themselves are kept very clean as were the bathrooms.Plenty of towels provided and everything you need in the room.The staff are always polite and friendly especially Anna who always asks how you are and if everything is ok.The breakfast has everything you need to get the day started and the area kept nice and clean.Ok the surrounding area of the Inn isn't wonderful but this place is a little gem and wouldn't put me off of staying there.A ten minute drive and you are at the coast,Seaport Village is well worth a visit as is a drive over the bridge to Coronado.We would always stay at the Inn on a trip to San Diego and would recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “A good value, not great location”
Reviews.Author: ajohns4
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here in April on our Spring Break trip. The price certainly couldn't be beat, but the location, although close to Old Town, was not exactly scenic. The first night we stayed there we heard police sirens all night long. It is very industrial, which we knew from previous reviews, and I wish I had taken that into our decision to stay there. However, it was walking distance to Old Town, which was great, but in my opinion you really only need to spend a day in Old Town and not much more. The room itself was very clean and comfortable. I recommend staying in the newer section of the hotel instead of the slightly cheaper old section. The pool area was very nice and when we went there we had no idea that the hotel was stuck in the middle of an industrial area. When we were there they were renovating the breakfast area, I am sure it is done by now. The breakfast was adequate, nothing too fancy, but enough to get us going for the morning and on our way. We never used the train station because we rented a car, but it is very close to the train station, just across the street. I would recommend the hotel, if you don't care about a scenic location. The staff was helpful and the hotel was very clean.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value and very convenient”
Reviews.Author: uplandbabs
Reviews.Content: Room was clean and well maintained, as was the property. Staff was friendly and EXTREMELY helpful. Price was good and the location was convenient.

Reviews.Title: “can't beat it for the price”
Reviews.Author: Chris D
Reviews.Content: this is the plact to stay in san diego,ca. i stay here every year since 2005 and it is a great place, close to seaworld, the beach and thr trolley station. rooms are outstanding! staff is very friendly!

Reviews.Title: “Satisfied Customer”
Reviews.Author: SteloTheTypo
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at the Old Town Inn when we flew into San Diego for a couple of nights. The location is perfect because its near Old Town and its not far from the airport (more importantly it is easy to find!). The hotel has a nice atmosphere there is lots of plants and the hotel staff are really friendly. Breakfast is available which consisted of muffins, fruit, waffle maker, etc. We got the Queen Economy room which suited our needs and was still a good size with a walk in wardrobe. The room was clean and there was plenty of parking spaces available. You could also check out DVDs (one at a time). We went to the Gaslamp and surrounding areas which was less than a 15 minute drive from the hotel. Overall I would use this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms, friendly staff"”
Reviews.Author: zcheeze
Reviews.Content: Location was pretty good, especially if you want to go to Old Town. It is, however, on the side of a major highway, which is odd... but worked out for me because it was easy access to the highway so we could go to the zoo and such. The staff is incredibly friendly and helpful. If you are planing on going to the zoo or other attractions, you can buy your tickets at the check in desk for a discounted price!!! Upon check-in, I got a very nice up-grade for a good deal.. and they were willing to haggle a bit :) Free breakfast was so-so, but hey.. it was free. The rooms were nice and clean... highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Convenient place to stay in Old Town”
Reviews.Author: PadreArizona
Reviews.Content: Old Town Inn on Pacific Highway s a convenient place to stay when visiting the Old Town district of San Diego. It is in walking distance both to Old Town San Diego State Historic Park and the Old Town Transit Center where one can access buses and the blue and green trolley lines. The blue line runs through many sites of interest to tourists as well as all the way to the border with Tijuana, Mexico. Day passes cost just $5.00 and are good on buses as well as the trolley. The staff at Old Town Inn is exceedingly friendly and helpful. The free breakfast and pool add to the enjoyment of being there. My wife and I did not drive to San Diego but had no trouble getting around. Our only taxi rides were from and to the airport. As an inexpensive, Old Town located, and friendly place, this is a good place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful & Quiet Place”
Reviews.Author: wisconsin81
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a quiet and comfortable room, I highly recommend this hotel. The pool area is surrounded with beautiful plants and it is very clean. The hotel staff is pleasant and there is a FREE continental breakfast (waffles, cereal, fresh fruit, toast, bagels). There is a dvd player in every room and the hotel has a small selection of movies to rent for free. My brother and I stayed in one of the economy rooms and were very happy. The room is small, but it is perfect for 2-3 people. The price per night is incredible for San Diego! The hotel is close to the main attractions and beaches, but I wouldn't stay here if you don't have a car.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel for the Money”
Reviews.Author: JanSalem
Reviews.Content: I stayed here two different times and was very impressed. My rooms were immaculate and the staff was exceptionally helpful and friendly. The hotel is located in an industrial area, so, if you are without a car, any shopping or restaurants within walking distance is limited to Old Town. However, the trolley stop is just a block from the hotel, and you can easily get to downtown restaurants or other attractions in San Diego. The trolley also goes to the border. I read a previous comment about the hotel being in an unsafe area. However, I'm a 74 year old woman, and I felt no qualms about walking alone to and from the trolley or Old Town. I plan to stay here again whenever I'm in San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Room smelt!”
Reviews.Author: ccjsw
Reviews.Content: Stayed two nights here. Location close to Seaworld and room big enough for five but it just smelt. The first night it smelt of maybe damp, but the second night it smelt revolting of cats wee - don't know what it was. Smell did lessen after turning air conditioning on for a while but it was too late and we were too tired to change rooms

Reviews.Title: “Had all the things we wanted for our stay...great room, quiet, and swimming pool.”
Reviews.Author: LisaETexas
Reviews.Content: Traveling with young children, this hotel had everything we needed--great complimentary breakfast, including making your own waffels which the kids enjoyed. The bathroom and room were really clean and the service excellent. They had a great variety of movies you could borrow at no charge (lots of kids movies). The swimming pool was a great size for children...we really enjoyed the pool. I would highly recommend this hotel; it is reasonablely priced, very clean, and the staff friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient for old town”
Reviews.Author: jqworle
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel very close to old town and seaworld, pool area was much appreciated and was heated .Breakfast was good enough to keep you going till lunch.My only quibble would be the rooms are awfully dark and the energy efficient bulbs dont emit a huge amount of light .

Reviews.Title: “Hats off!”
Reviews.Author: LJM41984
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Old Town while I was visiting my father last week. I have nothing but nice things to say. Each room is equipped with a DVD player and the lobby has a surprisingly diverse selection of films. The heated pool is warm and refreshing. I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Simple, Clean & Comfortable...”
Reviews.Author: frivolousfripperies
Reviews.Content: I really liked this hotel. The staff were wonderful and quite helpful in providing advice about visiting Old Town and things to do in San Diego. In the lobby/reception area, there was a table set up with ice water, coffee, etc., which was very convenient and appreciated. There is a little sitting area off of the check-in area with brochures galore, so you can sit & relax, drink coffee & look at brochures. Adjacent to this is the place where they serve breakfast. They really do serve a nice breakfast, waffles, etc. The hotel rooms are nice. Nothing fancy, but pretty spacious, clean and comfortable. Overall for the money, I thought I did pretty well in booking this hotel. Good value for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome as always!”
Reviews.Author: Leash81
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 5 nights (July 22-27) so that we could attend Comic Con. We have stayed at this hotel for 3 other past trips and it is perfect everytime. The location is outstanding especially for this trip since we used the Trolley to get to and from the Convention Center each day and then we drove around a bit on our last day to do some sightseeing and it is a quick trip to anywhere you need to go in San Diego. The room was clean, comfortable and quiet which was a big plus after several long days at the convention. The breakfast was great and helped to tide us over until we got a chance for lunch. We stayed in an economy queen room in the older building and had no complaints about anything. We were happy to find a DVD player in the room and a selection of DVD's to borrow from the lobby but we were so tired each night that we never got a chance to use them. All in all a great stay!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location but very noisy!”
Reviews.Author: AFII
Reviews.Content: It's good value for money; clean for a motel-style place, good sized rooms, acceptable breakfast and a fantastic location right next to the Old Town public transit hub for buses, metro and even Amtrak. The downside: the noise. If you end up in the 'original building' then bring earplugs and it'll be fine - otherwise the noise from the busy road, the buses, the trains is very intrusive. Sometimes a heavy truck or someone slamming the garage doors can make the bed shake! Otherwise, the staff are great, the free wifi worked brilliantly! I'd stay again, but might consider one of the more expensive rooms to see if they're more protected from the traffic noise...

Reviews.Title: “Had a great time! had by all.”
Reviews.Author: joeteacher
Reviews.Content: Your staff was outstanding! special thanks to Cristina "the best",sweet Mary, Mike nights,Ruben, Anna, Alyanna very helpful,housekeeping Claudia C. All managed by outstanding Anna.

Reviews.Title: “nice breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Thierry_Swiss
Reviews.Content: The hotel is good located in the old town where you can find a transit center to go around (either with trolleys or buses). In Old town you can find very good mexican restaurant. The breakfast is good, you can make your pancake! The pool is also nice, but the room are bit small.

Reviews.Title: “the old town inn review”
Reviews.Author: kim151015
Reviews.Content: i love staying in the old town inn cause they are always nice and kind to me and my family ( especially mary ) and the roooms are awsome; and the pool is sooooooooooo cool

Reviews.Title: “Always a wonderful time - Have stayed there before”
Reviews.Author: wwlady
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Old Town Inn-San Diego twice. The first time my nephew was graduating from boot camp, Marine. We had such a good time the first time that we stayed there, that 4 years later we booked the hotel again. They are very accomodating. Great breakfast, clean rooms etc. It is close to every where you need to be. It is right off the highway. About 10 min from the Airport, and close to all of the attractions. When we go back to San Diego, why stay at an expensive chain. Old Town Inn is great. The pic is from in front of the hotel. Thank you

Reviews.Title: “It was a complete comfort place to stay in with my family”
Reviews.Author: juandani
Reviews.Content: Well when I call in for a reservation Ms. Anna Flores was very polite and understanding of exactly what I needed. The first day we got there one of the things that my children really enjoy was the pool I mean thats all they talk about been in the room and swimming in the pool. They din'd care about anything else.And for my wife and me we just enjoy been in the room and relaxing. the staff and from desk were very friendly. make me and my family very comfortable. I would deffetetly go back. Thank You

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Facility and the office staff were friendly and very helpful!”
Reviews.Author: blinky72
Reviews.Content: The Old Town Inn was an excellent place to stay. The buildings and grounds were very clean. The office staff ( all of them) were very courteous and helpful in every way. The room was very clean and well maintained during our stay. We will recommend this motel to anyone we meet who is going to visit San Diego. Richard Imboden, Clarkdale, Az

Reviews.Title: “Home away from Home”
Reviews.Author: Anao
Reviews.Content: First of all I'd like to say the staff at the Old Town Inn, especially Anna Flores was GREAT. The location was perfect centralized to everywhere. It only took a walk across the street to go into Old Town and also the trolly station that can take you all around the city. Location very safe. The rooms were very clean and the morining breakfas\t was always well stocked. Not to mention if your forget some toiletrie thay have it. I highly recommed the Old Town Inn and will continue to stay there anytime I'm in town. Once again thank you for a memorable stay. It''s not to often you can say it felt like home away from home. Well job done Anna Flores. See you soon.

Reviews.Title: “Good for adults-not so much for kids”
Reviews.Author: logansrun
Reviews.Content: Stayed with husband & 9 year old son. I booked several months early but none-the less we were shown a room on 1st floor under a pillar and the room was very dark. We didn't come to San Diego for 5 days to stay in the dark. We were given another room but instead of the 2 queen beds we had one queen and a pull out couch. I took the pull out couch as you know how comfortable those are and my husband has back problems. The pluses- yes, a very good value for San Diego and the rooms were very clean and nice. The lobby and breakfast area are clean and nice and staff is friendly and helpful. The pool area is nicely landscaped but it is a small pool and no hot tub. There is a barbecue by the pool and my husband cooked on it and said it needs to be replaced. The location is a plus and a minus. It is a plus as only a couple miles from airport, a walk to old town, short drive to downtown and embarcadero, and short drive to Balboa Park and Sea World. The minuses- the location is a bit industrial. I picked this place because of good trip advisor reviews and I do think it is o.k. for adults but not especially for kids. There was a "hobo" as my son calls homeless - sitting one morning outside our room. I did tell the office and they did something about it but it was a little unsettling as he was talking to himself. We also decided by the same token we didn't want to walk to Old Town at night. The TV stations are slim and only kid programs were Cartoon Network which most moms know is trashy cartoons and nothing kids can watch after 8 p.m. There was HBO family which had PG13 movies - nothing my son could watch. He got hooked on TLC however, as it had the only programs that were PG rated. I know - we were in San Diego not to watch TV - but tell me that after you walk all over the SD zoo, SeaWorld and Wild Animal Park - you want to veg at night. I actually found myself regretting not spending more and going to a more kid friendly hotel as it would have made the vacation better. I'm not blaming Old Town Inn - I'm just saying that I'm not recommending for families with kids.

Reviews.Title: “Great location & great value”
Reviews.Author: MrsSparkyGriswald
Reviews.Content: We recently syated at the Old Town Inn after reading reviews on TA. I was happy to find such a great value on a room in an Old Town location. We stayed in the family suite and everyone was happy with it. That is not an easy feat with a 14, 9 and 4 year old! Our room had a living room area with a pullout couch that worked great for our little ones, while there was a seperate bedroom area with 2 queen beds for our older daughter as well as the hubby & I. We had a fridge, microwave & stovetop to boot! No way we would have had as much space for such a great price any place else. All this plus free parking...who could ask for more? Breakfast was the usually continental spread, nothing fancy but it did help fill us up before we headed out for the day to the zoo & Sea World. (We were also able to purchase discounted tickets at the front desk, which was a plus) Located withing walking distance to local shops, restaurants, and public transportation. The pool was just the right size and my kids had a blast. The staff was always friendly and helpful...no complaints whatsoever! I'm glad I did my homeowork and found this place on Trip Advisor. If we are ever in the area again I would go back to stay at the Old Town Inn again!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Value - Very Clean and Quiet - Close to Public Transportation”
Reviews.Author: movypirate
Reviews.Content: This is the second time the wife and I have stayed at the Old Town Inn, this place is spotless in the rooms and public areas, the staff is great, and the location is close to public transportation so we did not have to pay those outragous parking fees around town. They saw to our every need and even recomended places to eat that the wife just loved. Best Part was the PRICES. You can't go wrong here.

Reviews.Title: “Just fine for the night”
Reviews.Author: RBMok
Reviews.Content: This was perfect for what we wanted on this occasion. Nothing too fancy, but everything we needed for the night and the price was right. We were close to the airport, which we needed to go back to the next day. The cab ride was easy and the front desk was helpful. We walked into Old Town the next day and felt very comfortable leaving our bags at the hotel desk area while we toured. We wish we had realized how close we were to Old Town and how many great margarita spots were nearby- we would have gone out the night we checked in!

Reviews.Title: “Slightly overated but overall a good experience”
Reviews.Author: lyf
Reviews.Content: Old Town Inn is a no frills Motel with clean rooms at a decent location. Very close to the trolley station and bus depot. It was my first time in San Diego and I would have preferred to stay Downtown or at the Gaslight quarter but the Old Town Inn was close to public transport links. The best thing about the motel was was the staff was helpful, professional and courteous. Rooms were basic but clean. The biggest let down was the breakfast. It was poor in terms of quality and selection.

Reviews.Title: “Great for the price and location was not too bad”
Reviews.Author: kharm
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a weekend in San Diego and stayed at the Old Town Inn for one night. The place was very clean and our service upon check-in was very warm and friendly. We called ahead for an early check-in and they said our room would be cleaned in 10 minutes. We waited by the pool, which was heated and nice as well. Noticed a big BBQ grill in the pool area which could be used by guests. Our room was one of their older ones and small but perfect since it was just for one night and just for me and my girlfriend. It had a fridge, microwave, tv, coffee maker, hair dryer, and shower only no tub. I have no complaints about this place what-so-ever. Had I paid more than what I did I would have expected more but cant beat this place for the price. If you are concerned about the area, it is kind of adjacent to an industrial part of town and next to the airport but we didnt have a problem getting rest nor did we feel unsafe. It was a 2 minute walk to Old Town and they have a trolley service nearby. I will definitely be returning here since its a cheap rate and clean!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: Dillon13
Reviews.Content: We Received great service from all personal. The room was very nice and clean. The location was excellent . It was close to all points of interest.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: 5demayoPicoRivera
Reviews.Content: We like how the rooms are always clean service is great we stay by the pool and BBQ the location is great we walk to Old Town. We been coming for about 5 years for my Birth day and 12 of us always stay at Old town Inn.

Reviews.Title: “Good location near Old Town”
Reviews.Author: alaskanfool
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel after comparing reviews by other travelers and overall were pleased with the hotel. The staff was friendly, and maid service was good. Our room was in the newer section of the hotel, non smoking and on the second floor. Breakfast was fair, consisting of fresh fruit, make your own waffles, cereal, OJ , milk, coffee. Pretty much standard American continental breakfast. Upon check out I was asked if I had a good stay, I agreed, at which time the clerk had rubber stamped the receipt with a notation to leave a comment on TripAdvisor. Just as a previous reviewer noted, I also found it interesting the combination of the three flags outside, Mexican, Californian & US Marine. It would have been nice to see Old Glory flying. Pros: Nice location close to Old Town, which had some great Mexican food and trinket shops. Staff was courteous, check in was quick and efficient. The pool was small and surrounded by nice vegetation and palms trees, not to deep. Our kids enjoyed the soak. Cons: Our biggest complaint would be that the beds in our room felt like you would roll into the center, almost like too many kids had been jumping in the middle. Both beds in the room had this issue. If we had to stay another night I would have looked at another room for better beds, or another hotel. It also would have been nice to have had a small fridge in the room to keep food & drinks cold.

Reviews.Title: “Located next to the Old Town, good value for money”
Reviews.Author: Intrepidtraveller81
Reviews.Content: The motel is located within walking distance of the Old Town, right off the highway. Despite being on a main and busy road it was very quiet. The rooms were clean, comfortable and spacious. It was very good for the price. There was quite a wide selection of cerela, waffles, muffins, and bagels for breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “If you smoke or have a dog this place is great”
Reviews.Author: VolpeTravels
Reviews.Content: So for the money this hotel is a nice value. It is in a very odd location off a busy street around industrial buildings. You have to take two U turns just to get into the hotel. First night we stayed in the older building (newer one was sold out) and it was a very small room and the noise from the road was very loud. I would have to say it was even a little scary being so isolated from the main hotel. They next night we moved to the newer building (with a $25 increase in price) and it was much nicer. The Smoking and dog friendly hotels in San Deigo are limited and for that I would have to consider this a good choice (My Dad smokes and he was also staying in this hotel) Breakfast was just OK, nothing fancy. They do keep the rooms very clean. The grounds and gardens are in good condition and very pretty. But if I was traveling without a Dog and without a smoker I would stay in one of the large resort style hotels and pay the small differnece in pricing

Reviews.Title: “Convenient to Old Town”
Reviews.Author: Fifer_8
Reviews.Content: As has been already reported, this hotel is not in the most salubrious part of town. However it is within walking distance of the Old Town itself and if a dash of history is your thing you'll find it interesting. Also you can pick up a Trolley tour which will give you a two hour trip round the city. We found this very interesting and good value, especially as you can get on and off during the day.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here if you want to get a good night's sleep - lots of road and railway noise.”
Reviews.Author: Scoperta17
Reviews.Content: With the poor exchange rate, our three night stay at Old Town Inn cost us about Â£65 a night. That may seem good value, but given that this is the noisiest place we have ever stayed at, it really wasn't worth it. There is no sound insulation to the walls or floors/ceilings, but more of a problem is the inadequate windows for a motel that is located on one very busy road, with a freeway flyover adjacent. Add that to the frequent passing Amtrak trains sounding their horns, and earplugs are definitely needed for a good night's sleep! The rooms are outdated, have no safe, and have incredibly small bathrooms. There is a complimentary breakfast, but the food is poor quality and the coffee is bad. Staff were friendly and polite, and the trolley station is only a 2-5minute walk, which is very convenient (though you have to walk through an underpass which made us feel very uneasy as there were some unsavoury characters hanging around).

Reviews.Title: “Nice clean local Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Momof4Graham_WA
Reviews.Content: We went to San Diego from Palm Springs to go to Sea World and Legoland. We stayed one night. The desk clerk was very helpful and told us how to get to a resturant for dinner. Cafe Coyote it was a yummy mexican resturant. The hotel was nice and clean. It had a very nice breakfast. Everyone staying at the hotel was nice and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “The reviews are correct!”
Reviews.Author: lkestotravel
Reviews.Content: Very pleased with our stay. Nice and clean rooms, friendly staff. We didn't think the area was bad at all, felt it was safe and it is only a block from Old Town. It is also just minutes from the zoo and Sea World. We would totally stay again! This is indeed a great motel for the price!

Reviews.Title: “What an awesome hotel for the price”
Reviews.Author: VirginiaCalifornia
Reviews.Content: When I first made reservations for the hotel, I wasn't sure if I was going to get a bad one for the price I paid. For my surprise the hotel turned to be one of the best ones in old town. Great customer service and rooms were clean.

Reviews.Title: “Clean good value and location”
Reviews.Author: traveler2256
Reviews.Content: Checked in very efficieintly. We were given a room on the second floor of the older section. It was clean and quiet. Front desk staff was personable and helped with directions and recommendations for dinner. The Internet in the room worked sometimes, but other times websites such as Google or the San Diego tranist site would not load. The computer in the lobby always was working and I used it when I could not access Internet in my room. You could print up to five pages at no charge. I have been in hotels with broadband and have had the same experience with websites not loading. It just depends on how many people are trying to use the Internet at the same time. I would definitely recommend this hotel. I travel all over the world for business and have stayed in a lot of four star hotels that were not as clean as this place. We didn't leave for the airport until hours after check out. The front desk staff held our luggage and arranged transport to the airport. Breakfast was nice and breakfast area was clean and well maintained

Reviews.Title: “5 Star with a plus 10 in Accomodating,Friendly,Clean,HonestyPlus!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: LoisCaron
Reviews.Content: 14 of us checked in at one time and were met wwwith exceptional hoapitality. Our rooms were reserved, clean, and ready. We were all into our rooms in no time. We were centrally located and given specific instructions on where to eat, attractions, how to get there, and even made reservations for us to eat. I would highly recommend this to even people who are used to high class traveling. Best place in San Deigo! No one in our group had any complaints. I left a pair of shoes in the room and they were returned to me. In any other place I would not have gotten them back. This is a definte plus. Thank you to the staff for making our stay wonderful. We also had an excellent continental breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Well kept, great service, very clean and very accessible to Trolley!”
Reviews.Author: OhMai
Reviews.Content: Can't say enough good things about this Inn! I'm from Vancouver, Canada, and haven't been to many places down in the States... Luckily TripAdvisor made things a lot easier. I had to choose between this Inn and Comfort Inn which is also situated in the Old Town area. Thank goodness we chose this one. Why? We took the trolley, while our other colleagues that chose Comfort Inn had to take the bus and ended up being late for the Convention every time! We stayed here for the ACN National Convention from February 27 to March 2nd. Every staff working at the Inn was friendly. When I was calling in to check for availability three separate times, each staff member I had talked with was very polite and respectful. We arrived in San Diego early and the staff were able to keep our luggage in the Manager's office until we came back for a proper check-in. The room was basic but very clean. The two queen beds were very comfortable and the shower was great! Every day coming back from the Convention we would find our beds beautifully re-made. The concierge is open 24 hours. One night, two of my colleagues were thirsty and wanted some milk to drink at midnight... The staff in charge allowed us to get some milk from the kitchen. Breakfast was plentiful with bagels, waffle ovens, 3 or 4 types of cereal, orange juice, milk, muffins and danish buns. Commuting to the Convention Center was made relatively easy by the Trolley Line. Warning: It can get confusing at the Old Town stop! If you want to go to the Convention Center, take the Blue line (although it comes to you at the wrong direction... It's just that it's the end of the blue line, and so the trolley actually goes in reverse.), stop at America Plaza, walk across the trolley line and then Take the Orange line to Convention Center. You'll get the hang of it :)! Total commute time from Old Town to Convention (approx 15-20 minutes). I'd recommend everyone to try the Casa Guadalajara Restaurant situated in Old Town, and the Thai Ly restaurant in the heart of Gaslamp Quarters. Hope this review helps!

Reviews.Title: “Clean, nice, continental breakfast, comfortable”
Reviews.Author: rrortiz67
Reviews.Content: I loved this place, the staff was nice, accomodating. The room was clean, beds were comfortable, pillows were comfortable. It was really close to Old Town like 3-4 blocks. Was in an industrial part of the town but barely. It was really nice, and the price was right. We got waffles, danishes, bagels, cereal, coffee, muffins, all for breakfast. It was nice and well staffed, and tasted great. It was cute, decorated nicely. The pool was heated, but no hot tub, but that is ok. Had free internet connection and computer in the lobby. Very nice inexpensive and would definetly stay there again. And Free parking too.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, Exceptional Service, Good Location”
Reviews.Author: MissMyGolden
Reviews.Content: My husband and I met our friends in San Diego, and spent three nights there prior to leaving on a cruise together. We chose Old Town Inn based on TripAdvisor reviews, and we were pleased. We wanted to be close to downtown and the cruise terminal, but didn't want to pay $200 to $300 a night downtown for each couple, so we came here. Great choice. We got the family room that has a bedroom with a full kitchen and 2 queens (very good friends can share this bedroom easily.) Can't beat the price - it was less than half of the cost of staying downtown, and we were less than a 5 minute walk from the train station and trolley line. We enjoyed using the trolley for all our travels. A quick walk to Old Town, too, which we did a couple times. Ultra clean. Very friendly, accommodating staff. We called and said we were arriving early, and they made our room ready at noon. Pool was sparkling, although it was still a little chilly to use. My only complaint about location was the long walk to the closest grocery store. We actually used our kitchen, and cooked breakfasts in our room. Our husbands complained about the long walk to and from the store through a not so desirable section of town.
