The location of this hotel is literally RIGHT next to the tranportation depot and within walking distance to Old Town. There are great little shops and restaurants in this area and instead of going downtown like we had planned, my fiance and I spent the whole weekend in Old Town. No need for a car or worrying about parking. The hotel was clean, the breakfast was great and the staff was VERY accomodating. I was even able to get the wireless internet from my room (#305). I have to give a shout out to Oke (not sure if that is spelled right) as we had a bit of an experience when we first arrived. Our flight was five hours late so instead of getting there at 9:30pm, we arrived at 2:30am. He was very pleasant and when we realized the room we had been booked with was not what we were looking for, he happily moved us to another location as well as comp'd us for our troubles and pretty much missing the first nights stay. By the time we got to the room and to bed it was 4am. The bed was sooo comfy though (pillowtop) so I was able to get a good nights sleep. Even though I was given a smoking room (that was all that was left to accomodate my needs), it really was not a bad room and didn't smell as bad as it could have. I will DEF stay here when I come back. You cannot ask for a better deal in pricey San Diego. Hopefully this hotel will stay true to it's colors and not let big business drive their prices up. Thanks Old Town Inn!!

Reviews.Title: “Old Town Inn a pleasant surprise”
Reviews.Author: CLwriter
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Old Town at the end of the holiday season. We found that it was a reasonable alternative to staying in a pricey hotel in downtown SD, which after all is only a few miles away. The room was pleasant and the breakfast was quite good - you can make your own waffles. We didn't walk to the Old Town or the trolley stop - those things are fairly close but you have to cross a wide street. If you had small children or any kind of mobility issue it might not seem too close! Our teenagers used the pool - apparently it was warm enough for them, even in Dec. No hot tub though. The people in the office were helpful with recommendations for restaurants and also for directions in the immediate area. This was refreshing - too many smaller hotels seem to have staff members who don't know anything about the area around the hotel. We got more than we expected at this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Stay!”
Reviews.Author: dawn07
Reviews.Content: We had just returned from a 17-day tour at California. This must be our best stay ever among all the lodgings i had picked from Tripadvisor's List! This is truly a gem in San Diego! Besides affordable room price, their service is rated top compared to some star-rated hotels that i had stayed with. Clean, spacious deluxe room, all basic amentities met, friendly staff -Marie, Anna who assisted us during check-in & out, always greet us with a smile whenever we passed by reception! Love their breakfast spread! Waffles, cereal, muffin, danish and boiled eggs energized us every morning! Though situated at Pacific Hwy, there's no noise issue as mentioned in previous posts. A most strategic location for tourists, easy accessible to almost any atttraction- Seaworld, san diego zoo, beaches and downtown. I would highly recommend Old Town Inn to anyone who need a top quality accomodation in San Diego!

Reviews.Title: “Price & location can't be beaten!”
Reviews.Author: Strabo
Reviews.Content: Very convenient location that's off the Pacific Highway & very easy to get to all the attractions. The trolley station is abt 5 mins walk away. It's also close to a few shopping malls if you need to get necessities & stuff. AAA members get a preferential rate. Our room was spacious, very clean & comfy. Breakfast was fantastic. The kids loved making their own waffles. The hardboiled eggs were a great extra that normal continental breakfasts do not provide. The free internet was wonderful. Front desk service staff were sooo helpful & friendly. They recommended the Las Americas Outlets at the border (apparently just opened) when we said we wanted to take a drive to the Tijuana border. So our drive became an extended shopping spree instead & it was time (& money) well spent. Haha.

Reviews.Title: “Thank You ...TripAdvisor”
Reviews.Author: imoran
Reviews.Content: It was our first trip to San Diego. We wanted a place that was centrally located to the tourist attractions,the beach, and Old Town. The Old Town Inn was the perfect hotel. The great price, free internet access, and a excellent breakfast made this small hotel a big hit.

Reviews.Title: “Good Deal!”
Reviews.Author: GreatTravler
Reviews.Content: The Old Town Inn is a good deal! In searching for a hotel in San Diego in the $120-$150 range that recieved good TripAdvisor reviews, I found the Old Town Inn for under $90.00 a night. The reviews were very good and, in my experience, very accurate. It is near enough to Old Town to walk, though you do have to walk under the freeway. My daughter and I were not uncomfortable making the walk in the evenings. May I recommend Cafe Guadalajara on Taylor St at the edge of Old Town. We rented a car and the Old Town Inn is centrally located to the area points of interest with easy access to the freeway. It was very clean throughout the property and has been well maintained. We used a deluxe room that was on the 3rd floor at the back of the property. There was some traffic and airport noise, but nothing the "fan only" on the AC couldn't mask. The breakfast buffet was well-stocked with a waffle machine, bagels, sweet rolls, oatmeal, etc. All in all, the Old Town Inn is a real bargain. If we ever return to San Diego, I will definitely stay at the Inn again.

Reviews.Title: “Ask for Anna”
Reviews.Author: NWmailman
Reviews.Content: I've never left a review before, but my experience here requires it. I was dubious of the location...it was perfect. 2 blks walking distance to Old Town. Plus, it was right on Pacific...just minutes from downtown. Sergio, the nite clerk said, "Call in the morning and ask for Anna...she'll fix you up." He was right. She was a delight and ever so helpful in ways to numerous to mention, all with a great smile! The breakfast was the best Continental I've had. Great variety. The room was quite large, a nice efficiency, all utensils provided. We had a concern one evening about loud talking and smoking on the balcony outside...a polite mention and it was discreetly handled. 1 mile from several retail centers with many specialty shops and restaurants. Try Barons for specialty foods and don't miss the Flea Market Fri.-Sun. at the Sports Arena nearby. It's a buck and has it all. Ask for Anna, you won't regret it!

Reviews.Title: “great price, great spot”
Reviews.Author: SheTimesThree
Reviews.Content: I wanted to take my three teenage daughters to old town San Diego this October for a weekend of Haunted Tours and shopping. I wanted to stay "in Old Town", but didn't want to pay the price. I settled on the Old Town Inn, which was very reasonable, but I thought I would sacrifice with a long walk to Old Town, and a less than comfortable hotel. NOT TRUE! It was just a short walk to Old Town from the Hotel, and the continental breakfast they served was one of the best ones I've ever had. They even had a waffle station where you could make your own fresh waffles. Very friendly staff, clean and relatively modern rooms. Was a great buy if you want to save some money on your hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Really Nice Stay!”
Reviews.Author: Maxteach1
Reviews.Content: My husband, daughter, and I stayed here in June of 2005 and it was a great bargain for the price. It is not a 5 star hotel, but that's not what we were looking for. It was close to everything that we wanted to do, including Sea World, OId Town, and the San Diego Zoo. We didn't use the pool, but it looked nice. I liked being able to park right near our room, and the continental breakfast was a plus. Some people mention that this is not a safe area, but we never felt uncomfortable. San Diego is a big city, so most areas can be considered a little bit unsafe. We paid about $90 a night for our room, which also had a refrigerator and a microwave. This past summer, we ended up staying at the Residence Inn in Hotel Circle only because we wanted a two room suite and Old Town Inn was already booked for their family suites. Unfortunately we paid twice what we paid at the Old Town Inn and the suite was not that special. I would recommend the Old Town Inn to anyone looking for a comfortable home base for all of the San Diego attractions. You'll be close to everything, and you'll save a bundle, so you'll have a little bit extra to spend of souvenirs.

Reviews.Title: “the old town inn”
Reviews.Author: RDABGA
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the old town inn for 3 nights and had a great visit to wonderful San Diego. The hotel is a great deal for the price. It is located near Old Town and is within walking distance. The trolley is within walking distance ( public transportation that will take you all over the San Diego area). The room was clean and well taken care of. The staff was outstanding and very helpful. The pool area was nice and the pool is heated. I noticed there was a BBQ in that area I assume it was there for guest use but I didn't inquire any further. We stayed in a room with a microwave and refrigerator. I dont think all the rooms are equiped with them but it was nice to have them available. The room had a hair dryer and iron and ironing board. There are not hookups for your computer but we were able to get a signal in our room since it was near the office. There was a breakfast every morning 6a to 10a. Which was more than enough to hold us until lunch. Overrall we had a great time. The inn is located not far from everthing we wanted to see(we had a car) It is not far from the I-5. and only 1-2 exits from Seaworld. The location worked well for us and all we did. We will stay at the Old town inn next time we are in San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay for price”
Reviews.Author: hppygilmore
Reviews.Content: Rooms were clean and the staff was friendly. Downtown San Diego was easily accessible from the hotel. Old Town was within walking distance. The continental breakfast was more than your average continental breakfast, you can cook your own waffles and it lasted us until the afternoon. I have stayed at top of the line hotel and this room was the same size. Good value for your money.

Reviews.Title: “4 day stay in San Diego at Old Twon Inn”
Reviews.Author: mikelfenix
Reviews.Content: My fiancee and i just left the Old Town Inn ater a 4 day stay, and we were very happy with the room. Originally we chose the cheapest "economy" room but found it too small for the both of us and all our luggage. After 20 mins in the room we decided we should upgrade to the deluxe room with the kitchenette, and we were VERY happy we did. For the price, the hotel is great value, and if and when we are in San Diego again we will certainly be staying there. We didn't have the free breakfast, but i have read on other reviews that is it is great. The area is industrial but it is only a short walk to Old Town, which is very quaint. One negative thing from Old Town, dring the afternoon we asked at a Cafe what time they shut, as we wanted to come back for dinner. They told us 10pm, so we got back over to the cafe at .8.50pm, only to be told "the kitchen shuts an hour early" The building shut at 10pm. Pretty pissed off about that, even the 1 hour early shutting was wrong, as we were 10 mins early. Anyway, we drove to the local IHOp and had a fantastic dinner, so that cafe lost our money. Their loss. Overall, if you're going to be staying in San Diego, we can strongly suggest a stay, just chuck a bit more on the budgetfor the deluxe. Cheers :)

Reviews.Title: “Great Budget Option! Highly Recommend”
Reviews.Author: KC999
Reviews.Content: My husband and I needed a place to stay for just one night in San Diego and we had an early morning flight the next day. We did not want to spend a lot of money, and we stay in 4 and 5 star hotels often and travel quite frequently. Also, other members of my family were staying 2 nights. We had two rooms - our room was the economy room and my family members' room was a larger room. Both rooms were extremely clean, quiet, and quite nice. It was exactly what we needed. The service upon reception was very friendly and courteous - they were quite helpful. They even helped my family find a rental car the next day and answer other questions about the area. Although I did not have breakfast, my relatives did, and said that it was quite good and more than enough to eat and satisfied them through late in the afternoon. The pool area is very pleasant. If I had stayed longer, I would definitely have spent some time there. All in all, other hotels in San Diego are very expensive, and if you are looking for somewhere to stay that is less money, clean, and good service, I don't think you will find a better option than the Old Town Inn.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!!”
Reviews.Author: jjrogers
Reviews.Content: Took a chance on this one after reading all the reviews. Wasn't sure what to expect from the "industrial" area supposedly surrounding the Inn. We could not have been happier with our choice. Clean, clean, clean-- and we can be particular about that! Moreover, the Old Town Inn was like an oasis- beautifully landscaped with lush foliage, fountains, and a well-maintained pool area. Convenient to everything, especially Sea World (great for us, since we bought the 5 day pass!). We only used a half-tank of gas for the whole week and probably could have gotten by on much less if not for a foray to the Wild Animal Park. An easy walk into Old Town made this great for late-night dining, too. Breakfast, while not gourmet, managed to fill us up just fine with plenty of good choices-- waffles, bagels, hard-boiled eggs, and oatmeal. That in itself probably saved us an arm and a leg in food costs, doubling the value of this wonderful budget lodging. By the way, we stayed in one of the older economy rooms with a microwave and fridge (they call them "bungalows"), and enjoyed it very much. We were in 141, the end unit, which afforded us plenty of privacy and was away from the noise of the pool. The gentleman at the desk said the bungalows had been renovated recently, and they looked very nice to us. Small, yes, but "cozy" was the word my husband used-- very comfortable, even for a week's stay. We miss the beautiful Old Town Inn already and intend to go back in the future! Who would have guessed that the cheapest option in San Diego would also be the best?!

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended Inn”
Reviews.Author: germar
Reviews.Content: This hotel ranked 2nd out of 5 hotels my wife and I stayed at during our honeymoon week in the US. We decided to stay here based on comments posted below, and were not disappointed. Parking was indeed a bit tight, but there were far more positives than negatives. On arrival, we were assigned R#144, behind the property and with its own parking spaces. Our room was furthest from the road, so we enjoyed a quiet night. We requested an to stay an extra night, but this required us to move to R#128, which was right beside the road, so was a bit noisy. Also, instead of having a queen bed, the room had two doubles, which meant that 1) the air-con was placed directly next to one bed, freezing the occupant, and 2) the configuration didnâ€™t allow for a fridge in this room (#144 had a fridge). However, the hotel is located along a very quiet road, so there wasnâ€™t much noise. In fact, the whole area looked deserted, which was very off-putting at night, until we were directed to a 10-minute walk behind the hotel where all the shops and restaurants were. Staff at this hotel are very very friendly, and the breakfast is, indeed, exceptionally above what one would expect. Also very nice was the computer in the lobby with free internet access for guest use. The hotel is near the airport but far from downtown San Diego; however, it is still easy to reach with the nearby trolley service. A nice hotel which I will be happy to stay at again.

Reviews.Title: “Love this place!”
Reviews.Author: Lorind
Reviews.Content: What a great location for a family stay in San Diego - at a very reasonable price. The room was immaculate, the pool was lovely, the staff were so friendly and helpful, and even the breakfast wasn't too bad. It's not luxurious, but it is definitely clean, quiet, and lovely. The neighborhood gave me pause at first, but turned out to be perfect. Seems somewhat industrial, and it is near the freeway, but you can easily walk to Old Town State Park (about 2 blocks) and the Trolley station. The zoo was a few short miles on the freeway. And when we needed a pharmacy, we found that about a mile away, tucked behind the Inn, is a commercial district with supermarkets, fast food, pharmacies, etc. We will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Great Deal for the price”
Reviews.Author: formalika
Reviews.Content: For the price, this is a great little motel. I stayed in a double queen room, which has a huge dual sink vanity area, plus a separate bathroom/sink/toilet/tub. Room was super clean, and comfortable for 3 people. Location is pretty industrial, but it is so close to everything, and if you don't have a car you can walk across the street to the train. The continental breakfast is above average, they give you tons of food waffles, fruit, cereals, pastries, more than the usu continental, and since it is included in the cost of the room, this makes it an even better deal. I saw the bungalow rooms by the pools, these seemed older & much smaller, I would reccommend staying in the bigger/new part of the property.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: classicgirl_10
Reviews.Content: Wow! What a pleasant stay we enjoyed at the old town inn. From our travel book we weren't expecting much but once we arrived at the clean and well kept inn our expections were exceeded. With lots of familys staying there we felt very safe and at home. the staff was very helpful in directing us around this foreign town. The staff, Ed and John in paticular, were so patient and kind with the weary travelers. The pool was great and I even saw a hummingbird in the garden. I will deffinitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Budget Option”
Reviews.Author: AdvisorGirl
Reviews.Content: We visited San Diego in July 2006 to attend the Comic-Con annual convention. This is the largest event of it's kind hosted in San Diego and all the rooms in the city get booked well in advance (approximately 100,000 visitors over 5 days). If you are planning a trip to the city in late July, be advised to secure a room well in advance!! We phoned the property directly to reserve a room and the friendly desk clerk described the accommodations to me and quoted a $76 rate but suggested we upgrade to a larger room for $110 a night. I have just returned and read that we probably were given a regular sized room as we had no cooking facilities as described in a review below... Live and learn. In any event, most reviews on TA are accurate. This is a motel facility on a busy 6 lane highway facing a munitions plant. That said, it was not noisy at all in our room which was not far from the street. We had a king-sized bed, a small desk, a sofa facing an armoire holding a television with basic cable channels. The room was well maintained and the bathroom and dressing area were very tidy. One gripe about most motels, the industrial carpet was not clean - so it's a good idea to bring slippers. The motel makes a great effort to create a pleasant atmosphere in an industrial area. Travel time to the airport is only 5 minutes but we heard no air traffic! The staff are all very friendly. The desk had ample help to facilitate check in for the large crowd as all rooms were sold out the entire weekend. As mentioned, there is a sunny breakfast room off the lobby featuring FREE cold cereals, muffins, bagels, and rolls. There were 2 toasters, a microwave and various spreads and jam. A bowl of fruit cup and 2 self-serve waffle grills seemed to fascinate many visitors. Most people helped themselves to a large bowl of apples and oranges "to go," though the hotel asks that all food be consumed on site. This free buffet exceeded our expecations... Parking is free and although we were concerned we would not get a spot upon our return late one evening, I think we got the last one. All in all, there is little fault to find with the property. We did not take the trolley, but the depot is close enough to walk easily from the hotel across the busy street. Folks attending a convention have a 5 minute drive or easy access via public transport. All in all, we would return to the Old Town Inn. I would suggest booking the least expensive room as I do believe most rooms are the same. Ask questions if you call the motel directly to relieve any uncertainty. This is a very simple, roadside motel with above average service and clean, safe accommodations. A very good budget option for business or families.

Reviews.Title: “great location for Old Town!”
Reviews.Author: sugarrunfarm
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Old Town Inn for 2 nights in July 2006. As others mentioned, it is in an industrial area, but it was quiet and clean. Old Town and the trolley stops are a 5 minute walk away. We had a room with fridge, microwave and 2 burner stove. It came with all kitchen supplies as well. The beds were comfortable, although the bottom sheets kept coming off, but we found that just about everywhere on our trip! The pool was lovely and you could eat your breakfast outside beside the pool. Breakfast was more than the average....cereal, instant oatmeal, 3 kinds of muffins, fresh fruit, bagels, hard boiled eggs, and make your own waffles. The front desk was helpful, and they have a list of directions to local attractions. Very close to Sea World, and only 10 minutes from the airport. There was a computer for guest use in the lobby for internet access. I would definitely stay here again if we go back to San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “The motel and rooms were nice, but the location is questionable.”
Reviews.Author: del3ose
Reviews.Content: We checked into the motel on June 29, 2006 for one night. The motel is not near a freeway exit from downtown San Diego. You need to exit and go about two miles on the Pacific Highway. The motel is located in an industrial area. There is nothing around it like stores or a restaurant, but if you drive there are many businesses within a five minute drive. You can walk to old town San Diego, but I would recommend doing it during daylight hours. The check in area was nice and the lady at the desk was sweet and smiled the whole time. There seemed to be some questionable people at the motel, but I felt better when I saw more families checking in and walking around the motel. I checked in to room 102. It was one room away from the main highway, but it was surprisingly quiet. The room was one for handicapped people so the bathroom was BIG. The room had two queen beds, a table, an armoire where the TV and clothes fit, a small desk, ironing board, coffeemaker, blow dryer and little items in case you forgot (shampoo, lotion, mouthwash, etc.). The one thing I did not like was that the vanity was in the bathroom. So you can not blow dry your hair or use the sink if someone else was in the bathroom. In the morning they had a breakfast room that was set up for â€œbuffet styleâ€� food for hotel guests. You got to make your own waffles plus there were hard boiled eggs, toast, bagels, muffins, juice, coffee, milk and cereal. We did not use the pool, but we did notice it was enclosed within the motel; right next to the reception area. There was only one ice machine at the motel and it was centrally located on the second floor. The parking was tight. If there was a SUV it basically took up two spaces because it was so narrow. I donâ€™t know if I would stay here again, but this was the only place I could find for under $100 in San Diego with a good review.

Reviews.Title: “San Diego with 2 kids”
Reviews.Author: berryd
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights at Old Town Inn with a 9 and 3 yr old. The hotel is great for the price and the kids loved the breakfast and the pool. The room was small (our fault for reserving the smallest room) but it was very clean. The beds were comfortable. No bathtub, just a shower. Overall, great hotel for the price! We will come back but reserve a room that is a little bit bigger. :) We walked to Old town one night and had dinner (great park area for kids to run around), went to Sea World the next day, and spent the 3rd night swimming with the kids. For dinner, we took the trolley (accross the street from hotel) to the gaslamp district ($4/person R/T). We almost went to a ballgame at the new Petco Park but we didn't plan very well.

Reviews.Title: “great little hotel”
Reviews.Author: ozteddy
Reviews.Content: My thanks to the TripAdvisor contributors for suggesting this hotel. It was a great location within easy walking distance to Old Town, public transport and a 5 minute drive from Downtown and Seaworld. I would probably call it a Motel rather than Hotel (by my criteria) and my only grumble would be that we could hear the people in the room above us moving about (or practising long jump!!), so I would not want a ground floor room if I stay there again. The rooms were clean and well maintained, the staff very friendly and the pool although small was surrounded by garden and very pleasant. Breakfast is included in the rate and is a self serve affair with a good variety of cereals, muffins, waffles, fruit, juices etc. They also have a guest laundry which is a great bonus for people like us who were on a 3 week vacation. We dined at various restaurants in Old Town each night of our stay and felt completely safe walking to and from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Really nice place.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I just got back from 2 nights at the Old Town Inn and we were very impressed. The room was very clean and looked to be in good shape. We were upgraded to a room with a kitchenette which we didn't use but it looked like it would be nice if you wanted to eat in your room. The beds were comfotable and clean. The location was fantastic, a short walk to Old Town State Park and a public transportation center. It was also easy to get onto the freeway to drive to all the tourist locations we wanted to go to. We were thrilled with the free breakfast, we expected cereal and fruit and were shocked by the variety including the Belgin waffles (saved us from having to go out for breakfast everyday). The front desk was very helpful with directions and there was a computer and printer in the lobby that we were able to print out discount Zoo tickets with. The only complaint I had was that the nosie from the showers in neighboring rooms was really loud in the morning. I would highly reccommend this hotel to anyone traveling to San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Great Budget Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Kamabuki
Reviews.Content: Old Town Inn is a great Budget Hotel. The rooms were clean and well kept. The staff was very helpfull and freindly. They have a great morning breakfast. The downside is the noise. You can hear the conversations, tv's from the rooms next door. The traffic from the very busy Pacific Hwy is always a constant. With all things considered - would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “This place is gross!!!”
Reviews.Author: Willie83
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here on the advice of another travel forum and I wish we would of never listened to them. The motel is in the worst area that I could see in San Diego and we had our rental car broken into at our motel along with alot of homeless people sleeping right next door to the motel and it was very very noisy because of the trolley and you are under a busy freeway. For the price of $90 a night, we could of stayed in a better area of San Diego. There seems to be alot of night girls in the area trying to make there money. The motel is ok but the location is awful!

Reviews.Title: “Nice for the Price”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Well its a Motel and lets face it you usally cannot expect much from a Motel except a place to lay your head. Well we were pleasantly surprised to find a Motel with a nice clean room, great breakfast, warm pool, cheerful greetings and very helpful with directions and things to do. If you are looking for just a nice place to stay that is reasonable than this is it. It is not the Marriot (although I recieved better guest relations at the Inn than with most Marriots) so do not expect it, what it is is a great place to rest up and recoup for the next day. When we travel we are hardly at the hotel except to sleep and eat and the Old Town in satisfys this better than most. It is well located between Sea World (5min) the Zoo (10min) and Old Town just across the street relativly speaking. It is on a 6 lane road but we found no noise from the road to be bothersome. To summ it up Great place to stay cheaply with a fantastic continetal breakfast. Sincerly The Downeys Maryland

Reviews.Title: “Fine considering the rate you pay”
Reviews.Author: taichicat
Reviews.Content: Old Town Inn is fine for the price (we paid $77 on a Saturday night) but it is not "across the street" from Old Town like they told me. It is across a major highway from the trolley stop which can take you to Old Town, or you can walk a block or two to get there. The room was small but clean and adequate to bathe and sleep. The walls are thin, so it can be noisy. The breakfasts looked fine for young families, but we chose to eat elsewhere. Also, when you book, ask for a room away from the major highway which also can get noisy.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value, Exceeded Already High Expectations!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Front Desk: Staff was consistently very friendly, knowledgeable, and prepared to answer our questions. They seemed to appreciate our business! They provided their own info sheets on public transit, and mapped out some of the best restaurants within walking distance. Room: pleasant dÃ©cor, perfectly clean. Beds were fine. Ours was an economy room, $58 in late April, so there was no microwave/blow dryer/fridge. Breakfast: Very clean, pleasant, indoor breakfast room, with waffles, variety of flavoured and plain bagels fresh each morning, cream cheese, jams, bread, various flavours of hot oatmeal pouches and cold cereals, pastries, muffins, apples, oranges, milk, juice, coffee, tea, hot chocolate. Hot beverages were available all day and evening. Hotel Grounds: Nice landscaping, plants everywhere, a pretty fountain, and lights on the trees at night. Heated pool, looked clean, patio furniture to sit poolside. Location: Across the street (5 minute walk) from the Old Town Amtrak & Trolley/Bus Station (very good public transit system with frequent service to Sea World, downtown Amtrak station, Balboa Park, La Jolla). Old Town has many Mexican restaurants and shops, most within a 10-minute walk. The area appears to be fairly safe, even at night. The transit station seems to have security guards on duty most of the time.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for, a cheap place to sleep”
Reviews.Author: Angelfan
Reviews.Content: At a rate of around $60.00 per night, you cannot expect much from the Old Town Inn. So, I went with an open mind. The room we got was not located on the main grounds of the property, it was there older rooms, which I guess are the cheapest, they were located next door to the Inn. I first thought they were an apartment complex, but unfortunetely I was wrong. The room is very small with an even smaller shower stall. i mean I am 5'7, and had to bend over to get my head under the water. So if you envision taking a romantic shower with you significant other, than forget about it. We had a problem with one of the employees (Hanz) checking us in, he was just not the friendliest person in the world and the manager (Batrice) did say he was being trained for the day shift. We were given an upgrade to a room with a refrigerator and microwave which was great to keep some water. But, we found the freezer did not work when we bought some ice cream on night and the next moring we had a milk shake instead. So, if you get a fridge, I would not trust the freezer. The breakfast was very good, much more than you could ask for. Waffles were my favorite. Public Transportation was so close, this was my favorite part of the place, literally a 5 minute walk to the trolley, bus, and cab station. Which was great for us, since we took amtrak and used the trolley to go everywhere. All in all, The Old Town Inn was a decent place to stay, and I might stay here again for a cheap room. But if you can pay more than the $60.00 a night room, than I would stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “excellent”
Reviews.Author: Zahanoo
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Old town inn during a weekend getaway and we had a great time. The staff is freindly and helpfull and the room was clean and cozy. They had a very nice breakfast. The lobby and breakfast area were airy and the decor was warm and super clean. The pool area was a great place to lounge in the afternoon.

Reviews.Title: “It worked well for us”
Reviews.Author: Mom of one son
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel from reading all the reviews as did most people. If you read all of the reviews you will get a pretty good idea of the hotel. It was clean but not brand new, had a more than adequate breakfast with enough variety to please just about anyone. We did hear some noise from people above us and when the shower was started for about 5 seconds but no road noise at all. As soon as the people above us moved out it was quiet. We were in a 2 queen- bed room with the gas hot plate (and hood vent) as well as fridge and microwave. We are a small family of Mom, Dad and a 6 year old and we were mostly visiting for all the theme parks. We were only really at the hotel for breakfast and after dinner usually went to bed. It's located very close to Seaworld, the zoo and the airport and only 30 minutes or less from The Wild Life Park and Legoland. We attended all the parks and getting to them was very good with the hotel directions. I think that this hotel is awesome for a family visiting the city for the sights, the pool was clean and our son was the only one in it the few times we went but the weather was mostly overcast. If you have a huge budget, go to a 5 star but if you want to spend your dollars on the sights and park meals etc. then this hotel really helps. A rental car is best but it is very close to public transit if you are only needing to be in town. There is a crosswalk and lights to cross the 4 lane road between the hotel and the trolley/transit system and Old town. As for it being far from restaurants.....again, with a vehicle it is minutes from all the fast food and pizza you can imagine as well as Black Angus, several family restaurants etc. The famed hotel circle is also really close and we drove by it on our way to the Wild animal park and it looked like a zoo. It is just countless hotels on either side of a major freeway so I don't know how any of those places would be either quieter or nicer and the price on most I saw was considerably more than the Old Town Inn. Also there was no parking fee at this hotel to add up the bill. We stayed for an entire week and the front desk was helpful though usually fairly busy. For families with young kids I would really recommend this hotel unless you are made of money and like room service etc! The breakfast had a choice of 3 cold cereals, 3 types of oatmeal, a great fruit salad, hard boiled eggs, 3 types of bagels and cream cheese, white and brown toast, 2 types of fruit pastries, 2 types of muffins, OJ, coffee, tea, hot chocolate, and of course the self- made waffles and syrup. Pretty impressive for no extra cost. We were there for the last 4 days of spring break and never had to wait for a table and it was even quieter for our last 3 days. Bottom line.....a great, safe hotel for those who don't want to spend $300 a night and probably several times better than anything else in this price range.

Reviews.Title: “Sunlight or silence?”
Reviews.Author: valstock
Reviews.Content: Old Town Inn is a very good motel. Here is an advice: If you like daylight - avoid room 111. If you like silence - choose room 111. ItÂ´s situated in the inner corner behind the elevator so no daylight reaches in there. But it was by far the most silent room in our two weeks in California. We are non smokers and 111 is a smoking room, but we couldnÂ´t notice any smell or so. Yes, the staff, especially this tall blondish guy (Ed?) is excellent. The breakfast is great, and the price is a bargain compared to other sites prices. A $85 motel is a bad, seedy place in e.g. Santa Monica. But Old Town inn is very clean and has a nice, small, pool area. The motel is far away from everything except for the train/trolley station and "Historic Old Town" (which I jogged through in seven minutes one early morning, itÂ´s like a "wild west town" with small shops and restaurants and old houses). You can easily go by the trolley to downtown, but a car is needed to go to the beaches.

Reviews.Title: “Worked out great”
Reviews.Author: FPCarm
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nights recently to visit SeaWorld with our 2 sons and it worked out great. The GM checked us in and gave a great restaurant recommendation in Old Town (Old Town Mexican Cafe) which is walkable. The room wasn't fancy but was very nice and remarkably quiet given the location of the hotel. The waffle makers were a nice treat for breakfast. We would definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Old Town was adequate”
Reviews.Author: erc
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed at the Old Town Inn for a couple of nights. Even though the reviews seemed over-the-top I was still not sure what to expect because of the 2 star rating. The staff was friendly and helpful, the grounds inviting, the rooms clean, the breakfast satisfying. So, yes, it was a nice place...FOR A MOTEL. We needed a room with 2 beds and were given the only available non-smoking room which had 1 bed with a sofa bed and a kitchen, which we didn't request nor need, but made the rate go up $20.00 more per night. Both beds were VERY uncomfortable and the kitchen was not stocked (i.e. plates, utensils, pans). Very close to Old Town, which we enjoyed, and Hotel Circle is less than 10 minutes away by car, where we found lots of stores and restaurants. Pho Cali Restaurant was a wonderful find. Bottom line...Was it more than we expected?-yes. Was it worth the 86.00/night rate we paid- no. Would we stay again- maybe, for a bargain rate.

Reviews.Title: “Bittersweet Stay”
Reviews.Author: traveler1979ba
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a great find. The rooms are clean and cozy, the grounds are well maintained, and the location is close to everything. However when we stayed last weekend the staff lost our reservation TWICE. We gave names, confirmation numbers, card numbers, everything and they just didn't have it TWICE. Anyway as far as the value it is a deal. I would think about staying somewhere else first after the service we received but it's worth a look if you're short on cash.

Reviews.Title: “great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: tasjaw
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed for 3 days and found the staff to be very friendly. The rooms were clean, comfortable and quiet. The breakfast was one of the better we have had. The pool was heated and in great shape. the location was very close to the attractions. We will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Well kept San Diego secret!”
Reviews.Author: GoFlyNZ
Reviews.Content: This was easy to find because of it's excellent location and directions on thier website. Check in was fast and freindly and any questions were answered easily and maps provided. Our room was on the 2nd floor on the end and it was huge! Well appointed, it was clean and tidy and quiet. The only noise was from the rush hour traffic on the monday morning, but no problem here at weekends. The breakfast was awesome, there was a wide selection including fresh waffles which were easy to make, replenished frequently and everything was nice and hygenic. We could have spent longer here and would definitely return to this place when staying in San Diego again. If we continue to give it such fabulous reviews then it'll be full next time we want to return!

Reviews.Title: “Whoa now. It's not that good.”
Reviews.Author: ralfeez
Reviews.Content: Let me start by saying that I realize not ALL rooms are created equally, not ALL staff are perfect, and not ALL weekends are ideal. The reviews on here made the Old Town Inn seem like the find of a lifetime. I was there less that 24 hours ago and just have to disagree. It isn't bad, it is just a so so place. It is in the middle of an industrial section of the city. Think of an old Motel 6 or a Super 8. Then add nice landscaping, a reasonable price, and old (but clean) rooms. There are very few other business close by. There is no onsite restaurant and only one restaurant about 1.5 blocks away only open for breakfast and lunch. No stores, no restaurants, no shopping, and really nothing worth seeing that is anywhere close to walking distance. If you have a car and are on a budget, then this isn't a bad place. Don't compare it to the other hotels that are in the middle of the action and near other sites or businesses. Really just average and believe me when I say, not any better than that.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay here again! CLEAN”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The continental breakfast had anything you could want. We enjoyed waffles, oatmeal, and bagels every morning. The office staff was incredibly helpful. They were polite and wanting to please. The rooms were spacious and very clean.. We originally were place in room 106. I requested to be moved after one night as you could hear anyone walking up the stairs to the other floors. Our room wall was connected to the stair well and it was noisy. We were given a new room with out any hassle. We would stay here again as it is close to everything. We visited the Zoo, Seaworld, and the Midway.

Reviews.Title: “excellent old town inn”
Reviews.Author: speedy55
Reviews.Content: this is a little gem in a wonderful part of san diego.initially i worried that we were in a remote location but it is only a stone throw's distance from old town. the rooms are clean and well maintained, but what sets it apart from other motels is the quality of staff. they were incredibly helpful and welcoming. the breakfast has a huge selection, with something to suit everyone. we will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly Service - Budget Hotel”
Reviews.Author: HappyFamilyVancouver
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed in a Family Suite and found the Old Town Inn to be a great place to stay. We were given a friendly greeting and everything was in order. The room was large and extremely clean. The only thing we really could complain about was the location. The hotel is located in an industrial area fairly close to the airport. This makes it somewhat noisy. For the price you won't find anything even close to it in San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: TGann
Reviews.Content: My family stayed at the Old Town Inn, San Diego for three nights. The hotel was really a great place to stay at an excellent price of $75 dollars a night. We stayed in a deluxe efficiency room which included a gas stove, microwave and a fridge. The continental breakfast was excellent, and included fresh fruit, cereal, juice, milk, coffee and tea and we were even able to make our own waffles using their waffle irons. They had free high-speed internet access in the lobby, but I was able to access it from my room several yards away. The pool was nice as well. The only noise that was somewhat a bother was when the neighboring rooms used their water. I could hear the noise in the pipes in my room rather clearly. Other than that, this was a great place to stay and at an excellent price.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, Location,Very Clean,Served with Breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: tar
Reviews.Content: Who are we? My wife and I celebrated our 30+ anniversary (allowing a ten year time frame helps keep you right!) while we were on this Vacation. I am sixty one (also celebrated that milestone on this vacation.); my wife is five years younger. We are time share owners, since 1997, in Florida, Westgate Vacation Villas. We exchanged one of our weeks for Desert Springs II and another for Marriottâ€™s Newport Coast Villas (Newport CA). and spent two nights at Palm Springs Marquis Villas Resort, with another couple .(I have written reviews on these.) We were on our first California visit. We were on holidays, in California, from January 26 to our return to Winnipeg, Manitoba Canada on Valentines Day February 14th. We arrived home to -40 degree temperature. (It is the same temperature in C. or F.) . We often travel with another couple but this time we were just the two of us. Unforeseen circumstances prevented another couple from joining us. We also stayed one night each at â€œHermosa Hotelâ€� Avalon, Catalina Island ,(Review is complete) and â€œDesert Hills Hotelâ€� in Palm Springs.(In the Marriottâ€™s Newport Coast Villas, Newport Beach Review, I mistakenly called it Desert Springs Inn) I plan to write up on Desert Hills Hotel as well. We followed Trip Advisor for the hotels mentioned and Hermosa Hotel. We found the reports to be very accurate when one considered the consistent comments. (Also checked the reviews on the timeshares, but we were confident we knew what to expect at them.) This was a situation where we were in Newport Beach and had a night and the better part of two days to fill in before our return to Palm Springs. We had thought about going to Mexico but decided that was too much and Iâ€™m glad we made that decision. While we were at the Newport library, being guest computer users, my wife was looking after emails and I checked out the motels in San Diego on Trip Advisor. Old Town Inn seemed very inexpensive and had gotten good reviews. We felt we had been lucky with Hotel Hermosa in Avalon would we try our luck again? I phoned and was offered a room for $65.00 I booked it! We arrived about 3:00 P.M. my wife wasnâ€™t feeling very well, just a little off. I asked if an upgraded room might be available. I was offered a room with a queen bed, a microwave, and bar fridge. It was a little bigger and $10.00 more. (A Special Price!) My wife rested and I looked around. The pool area was very well looked after, as was the lobby. It appeared all the staff I talked to are proud of the inn! Again, all the positive things that have been said, we agree with. We did not experience any problem with noise or any other negative situations. My wife felt better after a rest. I got direction to Old Town and asked if it was safe for us to walk there. They said they had not had any trouble and we left about 5:30 P.M. for a walk around Old Town. It was great! There were shops and a band, very enjoyable! We got into a Pizza Restaurant,(My wifeâ€™s favorite!) around 9:00 P.M. We enjoyed the meal and walked back to the Hotel. We felt very safe all the time! The next morning, we went for a great breakfast as has been described in other reviews. We bought tickets for the Trolley Tour at the Inn for $28.00 each. (They said leaving our vehicle at the Inn would not be a problem.) We walked to the Trolley in old Town around 10:00 A.M. and had a quick tour of San Diego. We returned about 2:00 P.M. We had a quick lunch and left for Palm Springs about 2:30. This is a very nice hotel, well maintained and would be great for a family. It was great for us. I noticed at breakfast the customers were middle age or older. A really nice hotel, at a very good price, in a great location for Old Town or transit connection. You could take a tram to Mexico! Great value!

Reviews.Title: “Saved our vacation”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: After almost getting ripped off by a very shady car rental company just after landing in San Diego, we arrived at the hotel in a rotten mood. The smiling young lady (Kelly?) at the desk immediatly asked what was wrong. We told her and she gave us a small upgrade to our room to make us feel better. She keep smiling and chatting about where to eat, the easy access to public transportation if needed, and in seconds we were in a good mood again. The next morning, after having a nice free breakfast in the lobby, we told David the manager (who is also always smiling and seems to love his job) about how his thoughtful night shift worker lifted our spirits so quickly. He smiled (did I mention that everyone at this place smiles all the time?) and said that he does not hire experianced hotel workers. He hires people based on having a helpful happy attitude and then trains them on how to perform the job. What a great concept! Sure the Hotel is a very good value, but it is the great staff there that helped get us back into the spirit of our vacation. Thank you all.

Reviews.Title: “Wow! What a deal!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a great find. It is located kind of out of the way on a main thorougfare, but you can quickly travel downtown in no time. We were not bothered at all by traffic noise. The rooms were large and clean. Had a comfortable bed, couch, nice tv, large bathroom. . . just great for the price. Good breakfast in the morning too. Great price! Clean room! No problems!

Reviews.Title: “Clean - Beautiful Landscaping - Friendly Service - Great Breakfast”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Old Town Inn is well worth staying at for any visit to San Diego. The staff are friendly and very helpful. The pool is within a courtyard. A very pretty hotel. The rooms are spacious and clean. Our room even had two sinks, a large counter, fridge and microwave. We chose this hotel based on the reviews on TripAdvisor.com and was not disappointed. As stated in previous reviews and as we can confirm, it is close to a busy road but the noise was not loud at all (our room was the second room next to the busy road) and we were pleasantly surprised that it was quiet. The breakfast was great -- we loved the waffles made in a waffle iron as well as the freshly boiled eggs. This hotel is located in an industrial area but it felt very safe. The rates were very affordable. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone visiting San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Old Town Inn was great in some area's average in other's.”
Reviews.Author: BudgetJunkie
Reviews.Content: You know the old saying in the real estate market "location is everything". It rings true to some degree but if you want to stay at a nice, clean, roomy hotel that's a ways off the beaten track from all the attractions of San Diego then this is the place for you. I booked a family suite for one night as we were planning on going to the Zoo and Balboa park the next day. It was a very roomy with a large living area and a seperate room with two queen beds. One bathroom was a little inconveinent but managable. It was clean and large, that is the best way to describe it with a mini kitchen which we didn't use but was a nice addition. The morning breakfast that's offered for free was great, waffles, cereal, muffins, coffee, and juice were fresh and refreshing. If your looking for a good hotel at a budget price very close to old town and that's your priority then this is the place for you. If your priority is to find a place close to Sea World, the Zoo, Balboa Park, ect. look elsewhere but expect to pay a lot more.

Reviews.Title: “Best Mid Range Hotel I have Ever Stayed In”
Reviews.Author: saint82
Reviews.Content: This place was great. From the beautiful landscaping, to the immaculate and charming lobby, to the most helpful staff I have run into in a long time, this place was an absolute joy. The location was very convenient for both car travel and public transportation. It was about 10 minutes from downtown and the same from Sea World. The front desk even provided a one sheet information guide to every attraction that you could imagine. We used it, and all the directions were correct. The room was large and very comfortable. The next time that I am in San Diego I would not hesitate to stay here, and such a bargain. Did I mention that the front desk staff were wonderful?

Reviews.Title: “Amazing staff-great place!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I was truly amazed by this place. From the moment you walk in to the time you check out, you are totally bowled over. The place is gorgeous - wonderful pool, great plantings. And the staff was sooo helpful and informative - Doug at the front desk gave us information on where to eat, what to see and is wonderfully fuuny - this guy is a gem as are the gals who run the breakfast - Esperanza and Mailia (sp?). The hotel is very clean and very central to everything in towm. I would very highly recommend this place, but I really don't want too many people to know about!!

Reviews.Title: “good place to stay”
Reviews.Author: chicago_traveller1
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a night when visiting Old Town section of San Diego. It is clean and quiet, and is a five minute (or less) walk from Old Town. I stayed on a weekend and the hotel was full; pretty much the normal crowd - middle class families & couples, and seniors. I'd stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “All You Need”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My overall experience at the Old Town Inn was a pleasant one. Upon check-in, the front desk staff allowed my wife and I to view the room we booked online. Lucky we did because the room we booked was very small, and it appeared to be one of the older rooms. Thanks to Trip Advisor, I made sure to ask for one of the newly remodled rooms. The only one they had available was a jr. suite for about $89/night. I took it because it was a nice clean, spacious room with everything you would need for a weekend retreat (ie. small fridge, microwave, coffee maker, etc). They are about 1 1/2 miles to Old Town San Diego which has an array of authentic Mexican Restaurants (You should try Casa de Gudalajara's, we loved it) and about 5 miles to Seaport Village. I would definetly stay at Old Town Inn on my next San Diego retreat.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Old Town inn is a great place to stay, the rooms were large and clean, the pool area was great and the staff on the front desk a very willing to help. It was great to get up and have a good breakfast in the morning and be able to do some laundry in the coin operated machines. It is a 5 minute walk to the heart of the Old Town area ( Which has the best food in California) a 3 minute walk to the Old Town Trolley station which we used to get to Seaworld 25 minutes, The San Diego Zoo, which is the best zoo I have ever seen took about 50 minutes you can also catch the Amtrak to head north from there. It is only a 10 dollar 15 minute taxi ride from the airport. We would suggest asking for a room towards the back of the propety because there was a little traffic noise but it was not a real problem. I would definetly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Old Town Inn - What a Find!”
Reviews.Author: kermitbrit
Reviews.Content: I just returned from my 3-night stay at the Old Town Inn, and can thoroughly recommend it. Value was superb; staff were incredibly helpful and welcoming; grounds and pool lovely. I stayed in Rm 208; it was very clean and had everything I could possibly need, including microwave, fridge, coffee maker, 2-ring stove, hairdryer, iron & board, and cable TV. Location was fabulous - easy walk to excellent public transportation - trolley, buses, train and coaster - with transfers to anywhere you could possibly want to go. And right nearby is Old Town which is so delightful for shopping and restaurants. I would stay there again in a heartbeat, and certainly hope to soon. Thank you Doug and David and all the staff.

Reviews.Title: “A real gem.”
Reviews.Author: beemac70
Reviews.Content: Found this place to be excellent.Reasonable rates.Lovely large room (in the newer part of the complex,i believe).Really friendly and helpful staff.Nice breakfast spread.Couldn't fault the place one bit.

Reviews.Title: “good basic room”
Reviews.Author: yollH
Reviews.Content: I've stayed twice, once in the newer part (two story building) and once in the old part (one story in back). The rooms in the newer part, are newer, spacious and clean. Your basic room for a basic rate. I was not satisfied with the old room, run down and small. Ask for a newer room. Good location for San Diego activies. Close to Old Town. In business/freeway area so don't expect to walk around.

Reviews.Title: “An Oasis amidst the Industrial Sector”
Reviews.Author: pjhorton21
Reviews.Content: Location can be a blessing and a curse; it is both for this hotel. It is surrounded by industry on all four sides. You would not want to take a romantic walk with the spouse in the area around the hotel. However, Sea World is only about 8 minutes from the hotel (driving) and there are many stores and restaurants with 1Â½ miles from the hotel (Chili's, Target, Ralph's Supermarket, Big 5 Sporting Goods, In-N-Out Burger, Krispy Cream Donuts - all of which are located on Sports Arena Blvd. just west of the hotel). The hotel itself is well kept up and attractive. The staff was as friendly and helpful as I have ever seen, and our room was immaculate. The small pool was very clean. The expanded breakfast bar is similar to Holiday Inn Express. Getting there is a bit of a challenge, but you'll be OK if you follow the directions from their web site. A few other comments - parking is very tight - if you have a large vehicle or SUV, it takes some effort to get in and out. Both nights we stayed there, there was a lot of loud talking coming from the room above us until about 3:00 AM. Not enough to keep me up, but it was annoying. And one last minor annoyance - the showerhead in our room was 5 feet - it was a challenge to get my head under there. All in all, however, a very pleasant stay for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Clean, Clean”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Old Town Inn and enjoyed it very much. We have an opportunity to go again to San Diego in August '06, and I will book the Old Town Inn. It is across the street from the Old Town Station where you can access the train into town. The complimentary breakfast is excellent with make-your-own waffles, fruit, toast, cereal, fresh fruit salad, muffins, danish, coffee, tea, hot chocolate. The staff are very helpful (especially Edward at the front desk - thank you Edward). Our room consisted of two queen beds with a kitchenette. Excellent for long stays. The bath was clean as a whistle with a wall that separated the main room from the bath. Also, the shower/flush is separate, so someone can be in the shower while another is getting ready at the sink. Pool is nice and very clean. Five minutes (about) from the airport. Lots of literature on local attractions. Staff are willing to give you information on local area. Liquor store just behind hotel (5 minute walk) Restaurants are across the street (Historic Old Town) Wonderful stay. Would recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Ok, But Expect the Unexpected”
Reviews.Author: rbceres
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently stayed at the Old Town Inn. First, I found the staff helpful and cordial when we checked in. We expected an economy style hotel but were rather put off by the musty, deodorizer smell of the room when we first entered it. The room was located in a separate part of the hotel a little ways down the street. The queen bed was OK, (had a torn, worn bedspread), but the room was small. I would suggest upgrading to a larger room with more space and a refrigerator (we didn't have one). The first night we realized the air conditioning unit would not turn off so we had to unplug it each night despite assurances from the manager that a work order would be processed immediately. The second night loud music from the room next door ruined an otherwise peaceful evening. By 11:30 pm, after complaining over the phone several times,I told the staff in person I would call the police if they would not take care of the loud noise. I think the music stopped on its own around midnight. The next night we spotted a little cockroach scurrying across the dresser. My husband took care of it, but we were starting to regret our stay. On the up side the breakfast was good, the pool nice with lovely plants and flowers, and we were getting used to the quaint, old fashioned cramped quarters. Had it not been for the strange smell (bug spray maybe?), loud music, broken air unit, and the cockroach, our stay at the Old town Inn would have been perfect. The moral of this story is be prepared for the unexpected.

Reviews.Title: “Not Bad”
Reviews.Author: MarikoH
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Old Town Inn from July 21st through 25th, 2005, in room 106. The room was a typical room (clean) with two queen beds, table with a chair, an outer vanity area with a sink and a small coffee maker. Inside the bathroom was an additional sink that came in very handy. The hotel landscaping is very pretty (lots of greenery with flowers) and the heated pool is very sparkling (it would be nice if they had a hot tub). After reading the reviews on Tripadvisor, we thought the breakfast was going to be extraordinary but it was just satisfactory. There were two waffle makers, cereals, danishes, muffins, toast or bagels, fruit (bowl of canned fruit and apples), coffee/hot tea/hot chocolate, boiled eggs, and orange juice. The dining area can be very crowded on the weekends but during the week wasn't bad. The hotel is comparable to La Quinta or Comfort Inn and is very conveniently located to all the sights. The staff is very kind and informative and we would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “What a Treasure”
Reviews.Author: ourladyofrevlon
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in dozens of hotels-motels in San Diego over the last 30 years as I live just 2 hours away. We booked this by all the great reviews on this site. We hesitantly booked the economy room for $71. When we got there the staff was awesome. I told them my concerns on the economy & they gave me a key to look at 1st saying they want me to be thoroughly happy with my stay. Well, the room is small & a ways from the main area. Not bad by any means but I asked to see a little nicer & larger room. We looked at room 204 & were delighted. The front desk clerk, Sarah charged us only $15 more & let me tell you it was well worth it. A king size bed, sofa & coffee table, microwave, refrigerator, iron & board, coffee table, table w/2 chairs, large screen TV with HBO. Bathroom had tub/shower & outside the bath is a very large sink area with tons of rooms to put all my makeup & hair access. The pool area is lovely w/beautiful flowers. The deluxe continental breakfast was great. I have read people not so pleased with it but if you want a cooked to order breakfast stay at Embassy Suites for $200 +. The breakfast consisted of 2 waffle makers with the batter poured in individual cups, many hot & cold cereals, bagels, sweet rolls & toast, cream cheese & jams, apples & oranges, fruit cocktail, hard boiled eggs, juice & coffee, tea & cocoa. FREE! A small observance that I was impressed with is that their vending machine sodas were only 75 cents. The whole place was immaculate & staff personnel genuinely warm & caring. A special thanks to Doug at the front desk also who was so much fun to talk to. This will be my motel of choice for my future trips. If you have any questions on good shopping & eating in San Diego please feel free to email me.

Reviews.Title: “Not terribly impressed with The Old Town Inn”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We arrived at The Old Town Inn on 7-7th for a one night stay. I was extremely excited to stay there after reading all the fabulous reviews here on Tripadvisor. All the reviews I read praised David as being a wonderful host. When we checked in David was helping another guest on the phone and seemed to be going out of his way to help this person searching for a vacant hotel-(they were booked) going as far as looking up phone numbers for this wayward traveler. What great customer service! Unfortunately as David was busy we were checked in by Sarah who has a lot to learn from David it seems, she was curt, short and never offered so much as a smile or a welcome. The room being a non smoking room smelled musty and old, sheets came off both beds throughout the night, they don't seem to fit the pillowtop mattresses as they should. I would reccommend this hotel for someone not looking for anything special just a clean place to sleep at night. I was extremely disappointed as I expected a lot more.

Reviews.Title: “Loved, Loved, Loved the Old Town Inn”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Hotel was FANTASTIC. The staff was very helpful and friendly. Wonderful customer service. We are getting married next year and will have our out of town guests stay here. Great location!! The hotel was not only beautiful but very clean. Thank you to Doug Lay and the rest of the staff. We will definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “This inn is great!”
Reviews.Author: catsprat
Reviews.Content: Staff was fun and friendly. The inn was only an industrial area, but it was like an oasis. Close to everything, clean, reasonable - all you could hope for on a budget. Right across the street from public transportation and the old town part of San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Best Value in the Area”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Old Town Inn and agree with the reviews posted by the previous guests that this hotel is definetly worth staying at. We stayed there on a very busy weekend (The marathon was was going on there) and unlike most of the Hotels that were either sold out or were asking for $200-$400 for 1 night we were able to secure a rate of under $100. David the front desk manager (who must live at the hotel since he was the one I made the reservation with, checked us in, and then was there on our departure) was very helpful with the accomodations and directions to and from the property. He even provided us with an early check-in and was always seemingly happy to assist us with everything. Listen, this is not a Hilton or Mariott, but for the price, clean rooms, and EASY access to/from downtown I will definetly consider staying here again. Did I forget to mention....FREE parking and a continental breakfast that is nicely laid out for you in a dining room? My only concern in writing this review is that too many people will consider staying here and there goes the great rate.

Reviews.Title: “Great value and location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I decided to stay at this hotel after reading all of the positive reviews on TripAdvisor. We were not disappointed. This is definitely the place to stay in San Diego if you are not renting a car. We were able to walk to the Sports Arena, the reason we were in town. Also, the trolley and bus lines are right up the road. We were able to get to SeaWorld, the Zoo, and the beach easily using the station. The hotel is in an industrial area (next to a psychiatric hospital) but we still felt safe enough to walk back to the hotel in the dark. We stayed May 29-June 2 in an older economy room. We checked in 3 hours early with no problems and would have been upgraded at no charge, had there been a nicer available-but it was the holiday weekend, so they were booked solid. The room and bathroom were tiny and the shower made an awful squealing noise(not pleasant to wake up to!) The pool area was nice, beautiful flowers everywhere, but no hot tub. The breakfast was good, service at the front desk was unbeatable. Doug was especially corteous and helpful. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Clean affordable room”
Reviews.Author: Parker Holly
Reviews.Content: After reading other reviews here, we decided to try this place. The motel was very clean and the grounds are beautiful. We stayed in a deluxe room, so I don't know about the others. The staff was very friendly and helpful in pointing out attractions and ways to get around the area. I was a little disappointed in the breakfast, after reading such good reviews. It was to us just your average continental breakfast. We would recommend a trip to Old Town and while you are there eat at Old Town Mexican Restaurant. The food was superb. I would recommend this motel for anyone that wants a clean affordable room.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: FXDXRIDER
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Old Town Inn for four nights from May 23 to May 27. What a wonderful place to stay. My friend and I were even able to check in two hours before normal check-in time. The room we stayed in was on the third floor, very clean, roomy and quiet. Had a kitchenette and the staff even gave us a box of dishes, pans and utensils to use during out stay. The grounds of the Inn are nicely landscaped and has plenty of parking available. The continental breakfast they offered was another plus. The Inn is centrally located and the printout the staff gave us of directions to sites and stores was extremely helpful. Laundry room wasn't expensive and they have full load machines...drying time was an unbelievable 40 minutes. I highly recommend a stay at this hotel and have already suggested it to friends and relatives. Will definately stay here on my next trip to San Diego!

Reviews.Title: “Just as the reviews said. It was GREAT!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I selected this hotel because of all the reviews in tripadvisor.com after trying to find a good hotel with a reasonable price which hardly any at all in San Diego area. We stayed for 2 nights from May 20 - May 22 for our 16th wedding anniversary. I thought I got more than what I bargained for! I was impressed with the size of the room, the cleanliness, the friendliness of the staff, the inn's landscaping, and the BREAKFAST! We have been to inns with continental breakfast before, but this one is definitely the BEST. I agree with all the positive reviews of this hotel in this site. I haven't tried using the transportation that was recommended by others in their reviews but definitely will try it next time since we definitely will go back. But we did use the recommendations of the staff to visit Old Town and had a very good time. Old Town has the best Mexican food there is. The driving directions that the staff gave us to the Gas Lamp District was right and was very useful! We did try the pool and the water was warm, 82 F. The landscaping is pleasing to the eyes (water fountain, green grass and foliage, and flowers). Agree, if you are used to Hyatt hotel, this is definitely not your choice. But if you overlook the surroundings of the inn and just concentrate on what this inn offers to you, you will leave this hotel with much better feeling than if you stayed in Hyatt. Staying in this inn, you will receive the personal attention and help from the staff that you won't get in the luxurious hotels. It should have been called a Bed & Breakfast because it has the feel for it.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value and convenient”
Reviews.Author: archimedes6
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a total of 5 nights during 2 stays in April and May 2005. The hotel is certainly convenient, clean, friendly and excellent value but ..... the location next to a busy road in an indutrial/commercial area is definitely NOT attractive. Having said that, it is and ideal base for a visit to San Diego with excellent access to transport and convenient links by road (right next to the I% interstate). I agree with everything that has been said in other positive reviews.

Reviews.Title: “Highly Ranked and Reasonably Priced”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for two nights from May 13, 2005. I had made my reservation here solely because of the reviews I had read on TripAdvisor.com. I had been impressed by the fact that Old town Inn was ranked #16 of 226 hotels in San Diego, so I thought I would try it. I am glad I did. My room was a Deluxe room with a king sized bed. The room was large with plenty of room. It also was one of the cleanest rooms I have ever stayed in. It was spotless. The carpet was in excellent shape, like new, as was the furniture. The bed was very comfortable. The linens and bedspead were in excellent shape. It also had a small refrigerater and microwave. There was a large closet with plenty of space to put luggage. The outside of the hotel was well kept with plenty of free parking. I asked the staff for directions several times and they were always very helpful and knowledgeable. Susannah suggested several Mexican restaurants in Old Town that ended up having very excellent food. She also recommended that I try the trolley to go downtown to a ballgame. It was easy to use and dropped me off right next to Petco Field. The electric trolley train and also the city bus lines, both operate from the Transit Center, conveniently located about 200 yards away. Old Town, a must visit local attraction, is within walking distance right next to the Transit Center. You could just park your car at the hotel and access most places in the San Diego area from here. The trolley will take you to all the way to Mexico. It is also quicker if you consider the time to find a parking place downtown and also cheaper considering the price of parking downtown. I ate breakfast both mornings at their free breakfast bar. It was well stocked with a variety of cereals, breads, fruits, rolls, muffins, bagels, and several different juices, milk, and coffee. I was told they will soon add waffles. Espiranda was stocking the bar and worked as hard as any waitress I have ever seen. She never let anything get depleted. Be sure to tip her if you agree with my assessment. Because of her efforts, your breakfast will be an enjoyable way to start your day. They had a very nice pool area, although I did not have time to use it. After my two night stay here I moved to the Humphrey By the Bay because I wanted a bay view. Old Town Inn outdid the Humphrey in all ways except two, the bay view at Humphreys and the on site restaurant for dinner. In every other way it was better, cleaner, bigger room, and friendlier. That is not a knock on Humphrey's, which is higher ranked, just a complement to Old Town Inn. Old Town Inn was much lower priced. I actually wished I had stayed at Old Town Inn for all four nights. I had never tried a hotel before solely because of reviews like this one. I was very glad I had. If you are used to the Hyatt or similar you may not like this hotel, however you will save at least half on the room, not have to tip everyone who says hello, and save the $15-20 for parking. The rooms will be just as comfortable and the customer ranking of the hotel is probably higher than most of the Hyatts, Hiltons, and Sheratons in town. Compare for yourself. I highly recommend this hotel. I definately will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Was impressed ”
Reviews.Author: WDBGUY
Reviews.Content: I really liked this place, property is well kept and beautiful. The rates, location and access to transportation cannot be beat. The staff is very friendly and greeted us every time we walked into the lobby, they were well informed about directions to local attractions and even had printed directions to hand out. the pool area is nicely landscaped and attractive. I will not stay anywhere else is San Diego. They made it a very positive travel experience. The economy room is great for the budget, no frills basic but still nice. continental breakfast was exceptional, fruit salad, danish, cereal, muffins, bagels and even hard boiled eggs. The breakfast room was very nice. I do not work for this place...felt they deserved my comments.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I booked a week at the Old Town Inn after reading reviews online. With two children in college and a wedding coming up, budget was definitely on our mind! We booked their room with a King Size bed, refrigerator, and microwave and for the price were very pleasantly surprised. The room was very clean and looked recently redecorated. The staff was extremely friendly and helpful. Breakfast was continental (muffins, bagels, toast, cereal, fruit, etc.), but plentiful and served up in a new breakfast room. The trolley stop was a couple blocks away and old town just beyond that. Very accessible. We bought a three day ticket and took the trolley every day. Excellent restaurants within walking distance in Old Town.

Reviews.Title: “great location can move around on bus and trolly”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed my stay at old town inn,the staff was knowlegble I was able to take bus to zoo,seaworld. The bus was fast to get to your location 15 min to seaword 15 to zoo so why drive and pay parking.The old town inn is located by a main station for bus and trolley.If I go to san diego again I would stay at old town inn,the stress is gone on how to find your self around the staff will help ,just stay at a hotel who knows nothing about how to get any where and you will love staying at this hotel.They have a good breakfast the pool is 80 so the kids love the pool at night or on a cool day.

Reviews.Title: “Pleased”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Old Town Inn on March 12-16 and found the location great. It is easy to buy trolley tickets with any type of bill and get around which was the major reason we chose this hotel. The staff is friendly and was very helpful in answering any of our questions. One in our group went to the conference center and it is about 15-25min ride depending on how fast the second trolley arrives at the station (You have to switch from the blue line to the orange line to get to the conference center and anywhere downtown...about 7 total stops) The Old Town Inn has a great continental breakfast and we had no problems as other people mentioned about needing to get up early to get the best out of the breakfast. Even at 8:45 there was plenty of food for us. The hotel was almost completely booked when we made these reservations and I am not sure that our room has always been a non-smoking room but it was very very clean and hard to tell so we didn't ask. We felt safe and comfortable in this location - especially being a group of only females. It is a pretty place and Old Town is really close as are some great Mexican restaurants (and Italian). Other areas are just a trolley stop away. I would recommend this place to others. We paid $85/night but it would have been cheaper had we been able to book sooner and gotten a smaller room. Note: If you are going to San Diego, search online for food coupons. I found so many buy 1 entree get one free coupons!!

Reviews.Title: “Good ECONOMICAL hotel!”
